{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"How to Verify Your Facebook Page in 5 Steps [+ Why You Should]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/verify-facebook-page","description":"<p>The other day, I searched for \"Taylor Swift\" on Facebook.</p> \n<p>I was shocked to find <em>hundreds </em>— if not thousands — of Taylor Swifts in the United States alone.</p> \n<p>Fortunately, I was able to find the <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/TaylorSwift\">mega-pop star's page</a>&nbsp;easily, with the help of a small blue badge:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/tswift.png?width=1500&amp;name=tswift.png\" alt=\"taylor swift verified badge on facebook\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px;\"></p> \n<p>When searching for a business (or person) on Facebook, a verified badge is often the easiest and most reliable way to ensure the page you've found is authentic.</p> \n<p>As a business, it's critical you use a verified badge so that prospects and customers can easily find your true page and access up-to-date, accurate information about your brand. Without a verified badge, it can be difficult to trust whether the page is legitimate.</p> \n<p>However, the process for securing a verified badge is different for a business' Page than it is a personal profile. Here, we'll explore the steps you need to take to obtain a verified badge — plus, why it's important for your brand in the first place.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=0e17c46b-0ab9-43a4-8ddb-bdf86aa56e78&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: Free Facebook Advertising Checklist\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/0e17c46b-0ab9-43a4-8ddb-bdf86aa56e78.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">How to Verify a Facebook Page</h2> \n<p><em>Note: The following steps outline how to verify a Facebook Business Page — if, instead, you want to verify a profile, you'll fill out the same form, but you'll need to upload a copy of your official government-issued photo identification, instead. (You only need to verify a profile if you're a public figure or celebrity.)</em></p> \n<p><strong>1. You'll need to </strong><strong><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/help/contact/342509036134712\">fill out this form</a></strong><strong> to request a blue verification badge from Facebook. Since this is for business purposes, you'll want to click \"Page\" rather than \"Profile\" ...&nbsp;</strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/plain%20form.png?width=640&amp;name=plain%20form.png\" alt=\"request a blue verification badge empty form on facebook\" width=\"640\" style=\"width: 640px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>... and then click the \"Select page to verify\" drop-down menu to find your business page in the list. (Note: You must be an admin of the Business Manager account to submit this form.)</strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/my%20business%20page%20on%20form-1.png?width=630&amp;name=my%20business%20page%20on%20form-1.png\" alt=\"drop-down menu on the form to select your business page\" width=\"630\" style=\"width: 630px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>2. Since this is a business page, you'll need to attach a copy of a phone or utility bill, certificate of formation, articles of incorporation, or tax exemption documents. </strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/document%20upload.png?width=1114&amp;name=document%20upload.png\" alt=\"the section of the form that asks you to attach a document verifying your business\" width=\"1114\" style=\"width: 1114px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>3. Fill in the box explaining why the account should receive a verified badge. You'll need to include a minimum of 10 characters. </strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/tell%20why%20verify.png?width=726&amp;name=tell%20why%20verify.png\" alt=\"the box on the form that asks you why your page should be verified\" width=\"726\" style=\"width: 726px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>4. Add other social media account URLs if possible, as well as any additional comments. </strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/plain%20form-1.png?width=638&amp;name=plain%20form-1.png\" alt=\"the section of the form that asks you to include social media accounts or additional comments\" width=\"638\" style=\"width: 638px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>5. When you're ready, click \"Send\". You'll be re-directed to the following page, where you can watch the status of your request:&nbsp;</strong></p> \n<p><strong><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/page%20redirect.png?width=1850&amp;name=page%20redirect.png\" alt=\"the support inbox you'll be redirected to once you click &quot;send&quot; on your form\" width=\"1850\" style=\"width: 1850px;\"></strong></p> \n<p><strong>(<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/help/1288173394636262\">Facebook notes</a>: \"You'll receive a notification once we review your request. Please don't submit more than one request for your account. For denied requests, you can submit a new request after 30 days.\")</strong></p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Why can't I verify my Facebook Business Page?</h2> \n<p>There are a few reasons Facebook might deny your request. Let's explore two common ones, and how you can fix them.</p> \n<h3>1. Something is wrong with your submitted documents.</h3> \n<p>Facebook <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/2342133782492969?id=180505742745347\">outlines a few primary issues</a>&nbsp;you might have with the documents you submitted in the request form. If your document doesn't align with Facebook's requirements — or is low resolution or low-quality — consider re-uploading a new document that fits Facebook's standards.</p> \n<p>For instance, your document:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Might not be the type of document Facebook accepts (<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/159334372093366\">more on that here</a>).</li> \n <li>Might be a self-filed document. Facebook needs to see a document with an accompanying official signature or seal.</li> \n <li>The document is blurry, low resolution, or corrupted. Ensure you've scanned your document at a high resolution or format.</li> \n <li>The document is expired.</li> \n <li>The document you submitted doesn't contain your full business address.</li> \n <li>The document's language is unsupported (<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/159334372093366\">supported languages are shown in the image</a>, below):</li> \n</ul> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/supported%20language.png?width=501&amp;name=supported%20language.png\" alt=\"the languages facebook supports for verified badges\" width=\"501\" style=\"width: 501px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<h3>2. Your information — including business website, business address, and your business's legal name — doesn't match up.</h3> \n<p>When it comes to requesting a verified badge, accuracy and attention to detail is key. For instance, your request might be denied if your company's name listed on your Facebook Business Settings is different from the name that appears on your submitted documents.</p> \n<p>Here are a few considerations to keep in mind:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>The legal business name on your submitted document needs to match the name that appears in your Business Settings. (To fix this, update your business name in Business Settings or submit a new document that includes the business name that appears in your Business Settings.)</li> \n <li>Your document needs to include your business's full address and business phone number. (A partial address won't be accepted.)</li> \n <li>Your email domain and website address need to match, and your website should feature your company's name or logo.</li> \n <li>Your business name needs to be listed on your submitted document. For instance, if a utility bill has your business' phone number but your business name isn't included, it won't be accepted. (More information on <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/159334372093366\">acceptable documents here</a>.)</li> \n</ul> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Why Its Important to Verify My Facebook Business Page</h2> \n<p>A verified badge tells prospects and customers that they can trust your Facebook Page as the true, authentic presence of your brand. Additionally, it's often critical for differentiating your brand from other, similar terms that might make it difficult for users to find your business on Facebook.</p> \n<p>However, there are a few other major benefits to having a verified Facebook Business Page, aside from increased visibility.</p> \n<p>For one, Facebook's algorithm automatically places verified badges at the top of search results when someone is looking for your business. This is especially important if your brand hosts a few groups on Facebook.</p> \n<p>For instance, HubSpot has a few dedicated groups for various, niche purposes like HubSpot education or HubSpot marketers. It's critical Facebook users are able to find the more general, official HubSpot Page when searching \"HubSpot\", which is why it's good HubSpot's Page has a verified badge, which enables it to rise to the top of search results:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/search%20for%20hub.png?width=1236&amp;name=search%20for%20hub.png\" alt=\"search for hub\" width=\"1236\" style=\"width: 1236px;\"></p> \n<p>Since the verified badge will help surface your brand to the top of search results, you'll ideally increase followers and leads as a result of having a verified badge — a major benefit of the symbol.</p> \n<p>Additionally, a verified badge earns you early access to new Facebook features that aren't yet available for all users. This can help you level-up on competitors who might not have the same access.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>And that's it! You're all set to request a verified badge for your own business' Page. Next, take a look at the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/facebook-marketing\">Ultimate Guide to Facebook Marketing</a> for more tips on driving demand and growing your business on Facebook.&nbsp;</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=32a90224-1f14-45bd-914a-d4053a3a4d35&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img Forsey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/tswift.png?width=1500&name=tswift.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn99@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-51-302_79597526f0624fa3.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/0e17c46b-0ab9-43a4-8ddb-bdf86aa56e78.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn77@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-51-925_2b065da29ad9384e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/plain%20form.png?width=640&name=plain%20form.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn25@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-52-498_d9b53d8a07532196.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/my%20business%20page%20on%20form-1.png?width=630&name=my%20business%20page%20on%20form-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn9@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-56-756_210375dc7482b5e8.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/document%20upload.png?width=1114&name=document%20upload.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn57@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-50-01-877_15fd3b7b408b6f47.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/tell%20why%20verify.png?width=726&name=tell%20why%20verify.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn19@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-50-01-012_d9cace2fc0c540cb.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/plain%20form-1.png?width=638&name=plain%20form-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn18@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-56-610_0d30ed775db9d4a5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/page%20redirect.png?width=1850&name=page%20redirect.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn60@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-54-287_e931be06df6645bd.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/supported%20language.png?width=501&name=supported%20language.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn16@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-51-369_b856fcd1d2be941b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/search%20for%20hub.png?width=1236&name=search%20for%20hub.png":null,"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/32a90224-1f14-45bd-914a-d4053a3a4d35.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn70@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-51-763_83636ffc61a7b708.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fverify-facebook-page&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn79@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-56-382_57f8fc31520c9ffe.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370045},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"17 Tools & Resources for Conducting Market Research","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/market-research-tools-resources","description":"<p>We are creatures of habit, especially when it comes to buying behavior. We know the location of our favorite products in the store, and we trust that they'll work year after year. According to <a href=\"https://www.mckinsey.com/business-functions/marketing-and-sales/our-insights/the-great-consumer-shift-ten-charts-that-show-how-us-shopping-behavior-is-changing\">McKinsey</a>, nearly 3 out of 4 Americans stick with the same brand — and 8 out of 10 stay with the same retailer.</p> \n<p>People don't like change. It's a battle to get someone to switch to an unknown brand, especially during times of crisis.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>When a client wants to launch a new product, get into a different market, or open a new store location, the odds are stacked against them. It’s commonly known that most product launches are destined to fail — and that’s because they do.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: Market Research Templates [Free Kit]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6ba52ce7-bb69-4b63-965b-4ea21ba905da.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></strong></p> \n<p>In part, we can blame lack of research for why there are so many unsuccessful product launches and ill-conceived new feature additions. Founders and brand managers \"know\" it will be successful — they run on their instincts, not the facts. (It was this instinct that led Clairol to release <a href=\"https://allthatsinteresting.com/failed-products/5\">Touch of Yogurt Shampoo</a>, which some people thought was a breakfast food option.)</p> \n<p>Finding out if a product will be successful beyond the initial curiosity is just good business. With market research, you determine whether the opportunity exists, how to position the product or service, or what consumers' opinions are after the launch.</p> \n<p>If you're sensitive to the high costs of failure and need to gather facts and opinions to predict whether your new product, feature, or location will be successful, start by investing in market research using these tools and resources.</p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: center;\">Featured Resource: <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/market-research-kit\">Market Research Kit&nbsp;</a></h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/market-research-kit\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/market-research-kit-template.png?width=400&amp;name=market-research-kit-template.png\" alt=\"Market Research Kit (with 5 templates)\" width=\"400\" style=\"width: 400px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></a></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/market-research-kit\">Download the Kit Now</a></p> \n<h2>Helpful Market Research Tools &amp; Resources</h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/tools/\">Think With Google Research Tools</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/think-with-google-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=think-with-google-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Think with Google market research tools\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Wish you had information on your product’s likelihood of success? Think With Google's marketing research tools offer interesting insights on whether anyone is looking for your product (<a href=\"https://trends.google.com/trends/?geo=US\">Google Trends</a>), which markets to launch to (<a href=\"https://marketfinder.thinkwithgoogle.com/intl/en_us\">Market Finder</a>), and what retail categories rise as the months and seasons pass (<a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/feature/category-trends/us/month/en?\">Rising Retail Categories</a>).</p> \n<p>If you’d like to market your product through YouTube, the <a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/feature/findmyaudience/\">Find My Audience</a> tool allows you to investigate what your potential viewers are interested in and what you should discuss in your brand’s YouTube channel.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Free</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://data.census.gov/cedsci/\">Census Bureau</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/census-bureau-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=census-bureau-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Census Bureau market research tool\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>The Census Bureau offers a free resource for searching U.S. census data. You can filter by age, income, year, and location. You can also use some of its shortcuts to access visualizations of the data, allowing you to see potential target markets across the country.</p> \n<p>One of the best ways to use this tool is by finding the <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/naics/\">NAICS</a> code for your business, then accessing the <a href=\"https://data.census.gov/cedsci/table?q=United%20States&amp;tid=PEPPOP2019.PEPANNRES&amp;hidePreview=false\">Tables</a> tool, then clicking Filter on the sidebar and searching for your industry. Easily find out where your target industry is most popular — or where the market has been oversaturated. Another helpful tool is the <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/topics/business-economy.html\">Census Bureau Business and Economy data</a>, where you can also target premade tables depending on your industry.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Free</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/make-my-persona\">Make My Persona</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/make-my-persona-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=make-my-persona-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Make My Persona target buyer creator and market research tool\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Make My Persona is a proprietary tool that allows you to create a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/buyer-persona-definition-under-100-sr\">buyer persona</a> for your potential new product. Defining who might benefit from your product is key to marketing it in an effective way. In this tool, you pick a name for the persona, choose their age, identify their career characteristics, and identify their challenges, allowing you to pinpoint both demographic and psychographic information.</p> \n<p>This tool is most suited for B2B product launches, because you’ll be prompted to document your buyer persona’s career objectives and role-specific challenges. As such, your product would ideally solve a problem for them in the workplace or help their company achieve revenue goals.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Free</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.tableau.com/\">Tableau</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/tableau-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=tableau-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Tableau analytics platform and market research tool\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Tableau is a business intelligence suite of products that allows you to “connect to virtually any data source.” But the data isn’t presented in unreadable tables. Rather, Tableau helps you visualize this data in a way that helps you glean insights, appeal to external stakeholders, and communicate the feasibility of your product to potential investors.</p> \n<p>You can visualize data on anything from corn production in tropical climate zones to office product sales in North America. With Tableau’s tools, you can take as granular or as general a look you’d like into potential marketplaces and supplier regions.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.tableau.com/pricing/teams-orgs#server\">$12/user/month (Tableau Viewer); $35/user/month (Tableau Explorer); $70/user/month (Tableau Creator)</a></p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/\">Statista</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/statista-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=statista-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Statista data visualization platform and market research tool\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Statista is a data visualization website that takes data from reputable reports across the web and makes them easy and digestible for researchers, marketers, and product creators just like you.</p> \n<p>It helps you find even the most specific data relating to your industry. Are you planning on launching a new video game and want to know how many hours people spend playing video games? There’s a <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/317227/time-spent-game-console-usa/\">chart</a> for that.</p> \n<p>One neat aspect of using Statista is that the same chart is updated as the years pass. Say that you want to allude to the <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/550657/beauty-market-value-growth-worldwide-by-country/\">value of the beauty market</a> in your proposal. If your investor accesses that same graph a year from now, it will reflect updated numbers, as Statista always finds the most recent research to update their visualizations. (Note that Statista doesn’t carry out original research.)</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/accounts/\">Free; $39/month (billed yearly); $1,950 (one-time 30-day access)</a></p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://claritas360.claritas.com/mybestsegments/\">Claritas MyBestSegment</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/claritas-mybestsegment-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=claritas-mybestsegment-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Claritas MyBestSegment market research tool for finding target audiences\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Claritas MyBestSegment provides product researchers with tools to understand an area's demographic information and the area’s inhabitants’ lifestyle habits. By finding out what a segment of the population does — without having to go out and survey them — you can find out which areas would be most receptive to a campaign or launch, which competitors are located nearby, and which lifestyle trends have shifted or are on the rise.</p> \n<p>A snapshot of an audience segment gives you basic information on their household income, lifestyle traits, employment levels, and education levels. If you want more specific data relating to these topics, you’ll have to <a href=\"https://claritas.com/contact/\">contact Claritas’ sales team</a> to become a customer.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Free; <a href=\"https://claritas.com/contact/\">Pricing available on request</a></p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.surveymonkey.com/\">SurveyMonkey</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/surveymonkey-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=surveymonkey-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"SurveyMonkey market research tool for surveying panelists\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>SurveyMonkey is a powerful tool for creating in-depth <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/32206/An-Uncomplicated-Approach-to-Conducting-Solid-Market-Research.aspx\">market research surveys</a> that will help you understand your market and consumer preferences.</p> \n<p>With this tool, you can create targeted, uber-specific surveys that help you collect answers that pertain specifically to your product. While using a data source can give you a general overview of your target audience and market, SurveyMonkey can help you get more granular insights from real consumers.</p> \n<p>SurveyMonkey offers dedicated <a href=\"https://www.surveymonkey.com/market-research/solutions/\">market research solutions and services</a>, including a global survey panel, a survey translation service for international research, and a reporting dashboard option that allows you to easily parse through the results.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.surveymonkey.com/pricing/individual\">Free, $32/month (Advantage Annual), $99/month (Premier Annual), $99/month (Standard Monthly)</a>; <a href=\"https://www.surveymonkey.com/pricing/teams/\">$25/user/month (Team Advantage, minimum 3 users), $75/user/month (Team Premier, minimum 3 users), Enterprise (Contact for pricing)</a></p> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://www.typeform.com/\">Typeform</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/typeform-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=typeform-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Typeform surveying platform and market research tool\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Like SurveyMonkey, Typeform allows you to run research surveys to get direct answers from your target consumers. It’s an easy-to-use, mobile-optimized form-builder that's great for market research.</p> \n<p>Typeform’s distinguishing factor is that it shows viewers one form field at a time. In its templates, it encourages a more conversational, casual approach (like in its <a href=\"https://www.typeform.com/templates/t/market-research/\">market research survey template</a>). This makes it a better fit for product launches that target a younger demographic. If you’re targeting C-suite executives at established firms, consider a more formal option such as SurveyMonkey or keeping your tone more formal in your questions.</p> \n<p>You can create a wide range of question types, including multiple choice questions, short-form questions, and rating scale questions. Other features include the ability to recall answers from previous questions and create logic jumps.</p> \n<p>In a survey, you’d want to collect both demographic and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/what-are-psychographics-faqs-ht\">psychographic information</a> on your customer, seeking to understand their purchasing behaviors and the problems they encounter. The goal is to find out if your product is the solution to one of those problems — and whether, before launching, you should add more features or rethink your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/5208/4-ways-to-create-a-remarkable-product-strategy.aspx\">product positioning strategy</a>.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.typeform.com/pricing/\">Free; $35/month (Essentials); $50/month (Professional); $70/month (Premium) </a></p> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://www.upwave.com/instant-insights/\">Upwave Instant Insights</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/upwave-instant-insights-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=1200&amp;name=upwave-instant-insights-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Upwave Instant Insights tool for market and consumer research\" width=\"1200\" style=\"width: 1200px;\"></p> \n<p>Upwave Instant Insights is a consumer research tool that’s part of the Upwave brand marketing platform. While it isn’t advertised as a survey creation tool, it allows you to launch market research surveys specifically to get consumer insights.</p> \n<p>Instant Insights allows you to target audiences on Upwave’s <a href=\"https://www.upwave.com/partner-ecosystem/\">partner ecosystem</a> and visualize the data for easy scanning by key stakeholders and investors. One pro of using this platform is that Upwave distributes your survey to real people — not just people taking surveys for the money, which could skew the results.</p> \n<p>To create a survey, you <a href=\"https://insights.upwave.com/quote\">sign up on the Upwave platform</a>, click your name in the upper right-hand corner, and click “My Surveys,” where you can create as many surveys as you want. For the Basic option, you have a 6-question limit, while the Advanced option allows you to include unlimited questions.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://insights.upwave.com/quote\">$2/study participant (Basic); $3/study participant (Extended); $4/study participant (Advanced)</a></p> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"http://www.loop11.com/\">Loop11</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/loop11-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=loop11-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Loop11 usability testing platform for market research\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Loop11 is a user experience testing platform that allows you to test the usability of your website, study user intent, test the information architecture of your site, and examine how the user experience changes based on the device they’re using.</p> \n<p>This tool is useful for market research because you can find out whether your target consumers find your site easy to navigate. You can also identify snags that prevent conversions.</p> \n<p>Loop11 tests your site by making users perform tasks. They then complete a short question about how easy or difficult the task was to complete. Your product may be phenomenal, but unless consumers can buy it through your site, you won’t launch it successfully.</p> \n<p>You can use Loop11’s participants or bring in your own.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.loop11.com/pricing/\">$63/month (Rapid Insights), $239/month (Pro), $399/month (Enterprise)</a></p> \n<h3>11. <a href=\"http://www.userlytics.com/sitepublic/\">Userlytics</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/userlytics-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=userlytics-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Userlytics usability testing platform for market research\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Like Loop11, Userlytics allows you to test the usability of your website, mobile app, and site prototype. You can target different devices, define a buyer persona, and disqualify participants based on screening questions.</p> \n<p>Testing is based on tasks that your test-takers carry out. They then answer a simple question about the difficulty of the task. You can structure the question in various ways; you can leave it open-ended, provide multiple choices, or ask for a rating. Other formats you can use include System Usability Scale (SUS) questions, Net Promoter Score (NPS) questions, and Single Ease Questions (SEQ).</p> \n<p>Userlytics performs both a webcam and a screen recording. You can compare the user’s answers with their reactions on video to understand how they feel when they’re interacting with your assets.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.userlytics.com/prices-plans\">$49/participant (Quick &amp; Easy); $69/participant (Annual Enterprise); Custom pricing available on request</a></p> \n<h3>12. <a href=\"https://www.temper.io/\">Temper</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/temper-market-research-tool.png?width=650&amp;name=temper-market-research-tool.png\" alt=\"Temper quick survey tool for market research\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Sometimes you need a no-frills test to take the pulse of consumers. Temper allows you to create a question, grab a snippet of code, and pop it onto your website. The smiley face, \"meh\" face, and frown face make it easy for viewers to make a snap judgment.</p> \n<p>One great way to use this tool is by adding the widget on a blog post announcing the launch of your new product. That way, you can find out general sentiment on the product before launching it. You can also add it to a product page, an email, or a landing page.</p> \n<p>When you include the widget, you can change the question to something that’s tailored to your offerings.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.temper.io/pricing\">$12/month (Hobby), $49/month (Pro), $89/month (Business), $199/month (White Label</a>)</p> \n<h3>13. <a href=\"https://nielseniq.com/global/en/\">NielsenIQ</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/nielseniq-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=nielseniq-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"NielsenIQ market research consultant for enterprise firms\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>NielsenIQ is a retail and consumer intelligence consultant that works with you to collect consumer insights, identify the best distribution channels for your product, and create a range of products that addresses the needs of your target buyers.</p> \n<p>This service helps you look at your product launch from all angles and delivers <a href=\"https://nielseniq.com/global/en/solutions/volumetric-forecasting/\">forecasting data</a> that predicts how your sales will perform upon launch. NielsenIQ can also run <a href=\"https://nielseniq.com/global/en/solutions/consumer-analytics/\">consumer insights surveys</a> on their list of panelists and partners.</p> \n<p>Because it operates like a consultant and not as a self-service software, NielsenIQ is a better option for established firms with a bigger product launch budget.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://nielseniq.com/global/en/about-us/contact-us/\">Pricing available on request</a></p> \n<h3>14. <a href=\"https://app.neilpatel.com/en/ubersuggest/overview\">Ubersuggest</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/ubersuggest-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=1200&amp;name=ubersuggest-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Ubersuggest keyword research tool for market research\" width=\"1200\" style=\"width: 1200px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Ubersuggest is a simple tool for doing keyword and content research. You can input a phrase, and it'll create a list of keyword suggestions. You can also see top performing articles and pages so that you get an initial understanding of the type of content that ranks for the keywords.</p> \n<p>This tool is useful for market research because you can see who your top competitors are, how often your product is searched for, and whether there’s enough space in the market for the type of product you’re launching. You can also find out the questions your target audience asks in relation to the product. Each of these questions can be turned into a blog post that can inform your audience, increasing your brand authority and driving conversions.</p> \n<p>Alternatives to Ubersuggest include <a href=\"https://moz.com/explorer\">Moz</a>, <a href=\"https://ahrefs.com/keywords-explorer\">Ahrefs</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.semrush.com/analytics/keywordoverview/\">SEMRush</a>.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://app.neilpatel.com/en/pricing\">Free; $29/month (Individual); $49/month (Business); $99/month (Enterprise / Agency) </a></p> \n<h3>15. <a href=\"http://www.pewresearch.org/data/\">Pew Research Center</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/pew-research-center-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=1200&amp;name=pew-research-center-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Pew Research Center data sets for market research\" width=\"1200\" style=\"width: 1200px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>From economic conditions, to political attitudes, to social media usage, the Pew Research Center website has a ton of free research that you can use to better understand your target market. Best of all, the site has <a href=\"https://www.pewresearch.org/publications/?formats=feature\">interactive articles</a> that allow you to filter and sift through the data for more granular, targeted insights.</p> \n<p>Topics include U.S. politics, digital media, social trends, religion, science, and technology.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Free</p> \n<h3>16. <a href=\"https://brandmentions.com/socialmention/\">BrandMentions</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/brandmentions-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=brandmentions-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"BrandMentions social monitoring platform for market research\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>BrandMentions is a social media monitoring platform that can help you understand what your prospective customers are buzzing about online. Search for a keyword, and BrandMentions will show you recent social posts that contain that keyword, along with the context of its usage. After subscribing to the platform, you can also get sentiment analysis on the keyword.</p> \n<p>You’ll also get other metrics such as Reach (how many people view the keyword per day), Performance (how many people engage with the keyword per day), and Mentions by Weekday (when people are mentioning the keyword).</p> \n<p>You can use this tool for market research by finding out when people are looking for your product on social media sites. When you start announcing the new product, you can use insights from this tool to post about the launch at exactly the right time. It also allows you to find out how people are generally feeling about the type of product you’re launching. That way, you can better refine the tone of your campaigns.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://brandmentions.com/pricing.php\">$99/month (Growing Business); $ 299/month (Company); $ 499/month (Enterprise/Agency)</a></p> \n<h3>17. <a href=\"https://www.qualtrics.com/uk/research-services/online-sample/\">Qualtrics Market Research Panels</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/qualtrics-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&amp;name=qualtrics-market-research-tool.jpeg\" alt=\"Qualtrics market research panels for consumer insights\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Qualtrics takes the pain of finding respondents for your market research surveys through an online sample service. After identifying your target audience, you can go to Qualtrics for access to a representative sample. You can either use your chosen <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/service/customer-feedback\">survey software</a> or use <a href=\"https://www.qualtrics.com/uk/core-xm/\">Qualtrics’ built-in platform</a> for insights and feedback.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.qualtrics.com/uk/research-services-demo/\">Pricing available on request</a></p> \n<h2>Conduct Market Research for a Successful Product Launch</h2> \n<p>Conducting market research is essential to successfully launch a product to market. With the tools we’ve shared, you can find out who’s looking for your product, why they need it, and how you can better market it upon launch, ensuring that it’s a success.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in April 2016 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><em><a class=\"cta_button\" sdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn53@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-59-809_f6e309c59ad04ad3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/typeform-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&name=typeform-market-research-tool.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn56@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-51-389_70e296fad84c98b2.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/upwave-instant-insights-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=1200&name=upwave-instant-insights-market-research-tool.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn85@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-50-01-336_5a900a4ec1404a79.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/loop11-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&name=loop11-market-research-tool.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn93@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-55-336_1d6da638da366e91.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/userlytics-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&name=userlytics-market-research-tool.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn78@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-58-478_c29658985dd49b5a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/temper-market-research-tool.png?width=650&name=temper-market-research-tool.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn85@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-52-090_8dff385ba95965f1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/nielseniq-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&name=nielseniq-market-research-tool.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn4@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-57-646_2774e5c79a34f972.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/ubersuggest-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=1200&name=ubersuggest-market-research-tool.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn79@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-51-263_77afd4a966033bea.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/pew-research-center-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=1200&name=pew-research-center-market-research-tool.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn21@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-54-983_c55e341affc2447a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/brandmentions-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&name=brandmentions-market-research-tool.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn76@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-59-244_cc286dc32c109ed3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/qualtrics-market-research-tool.jpeg?width=650&name=qualtrics-market-research-tool.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn14@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-56-575_d125aa91cc087d4c.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/560aa80b-9e0b-4615-851c-f23e4f49b62f.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn98@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-58-608_56bafbfb62a605be.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fmarket-research-tools-resources&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn46@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-57-064_43f9015b8df89434.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370093},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"What is Comparative Advertising? [+ Examples]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/comparative-advertising","description":"<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/advertising?_ga=2.260943437.1342203147.1615561491-1046125508.1615561491\">Advertising</a>&nbsp;is the process of creating messages that raise awareness of your brand.</p>  \n<p>These messages can have various purposes like attracting potential customers, promoting upcoming sales, and introducing new products to market. Most advertisements center around one business, but a unique type, called comparative advertising, centers around two.</p> \n<p>When done right, comparative ads can successfully convince consumers to do business with one brand over another. But, when done wrong, companies may find themselves in the middle of a lawsuit. Given this, using comparative advertising requires care and attention.</p> \n<p>In this post, we’ll explain what comparative advertising is, give examples from real-life businesses, explain the legality of using the strategy, and present pros and cons that you can use to make the best decision for your business.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: Free Ad Campaign Planning Kit\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>These ads can directly or indirectly mention a competitor, but consumers can typically deduce who the other business is through product features and call-outs. Comparative ads also give customers a direct point of comparison between two companies, as they can view products and assess features all at once, rather than needing to seek out information from multiple sources.</p> \n<p>Although they may feature two businesses, it is important to note that one company creates the ad for their benefit, so its tone is swayed in their favor. That being said, businesses aren’t allowed to make false claims about their competitors, so consumers are presented with factual information.</p> \n<p>There is no set template for comparative advertisements; they can be digital or print, videos or images, humorous or serious. Many businesses take advantage of 21st-century viral culture and share ads on social media platforms and capitalize on the traffic from likes, retweets, follows, and shares.</p> \n<h2>Comparative Advertising Examples</h2> \n<p>Below we’ll go over some real-life examples of comparative advertising to help you understand the practice.</p> \n<h3>Popeyes</h3> \n<p>Popeyes is an American fast-food chain that serves fried chicken. Chick-fil-A is their direct industry competitor, well known for being closed on Sundays.</p> \n<p>Popeyes capitalized on this and created a comparative advertisement that emphasized that their restaurant is open on Sundays, ready and able to serve consumers every day of the week, especially while Chick-fil-A takes a day off. The video is shown below.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 200px; max-height: 113px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.5%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"200\" height=\"113\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/KJxLX9suK6I?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<h3>Sprint</h3> \n<p>Verizon, a cellular provider, used the same actor as the face of their commercials for nine years. Sprint, an industry competitor, poached the actor in 2016 and used his switch to their service to take a unique approach to comparative advertising.</p> \n<p>In the video below, Sprint essentially says, if a long-time, loyal Verizon actor can switch to Sprint, why can’t you change as well? The business positions itself as a qualified competitor by saying that their cell phone service has a 1% difference in coverage than Verizon.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 200px; max-height: 113px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.5%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"200\" height=\"113\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/UlOZYJ3l9SA?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>Cocoon by Sealy</h3> \n<p>Casper is a well-known mattress brand that has managed to garner significant hype and recognizability for its products.</p> \n<p>Cocoon by Sealy, a direct competitor, uses comparative advertising in search engine result pages (SERPs) to target Casper’s intended audience. The company placed a paid ad in a SERP for the term Casper mattress (shown below), with the headline “Don’t Buy the Hype, Shop Cocoon &amp; Save Hundreds.”</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/casper%20serp.jpg?width=495&amp;name=casper%20serp.jpg\" alt=\"paid ads top result in google search engine results page for &quot;casper mattress&quot; query\" width=\"495\" style=\"width: 495px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Cocoon claims that its competitor is only a competitor because people buy for the name-brand hype. If a curious consumer clicks on the ad, they learn that Cocoon offers mattresses that are worthwhile because they are conducive to peaceful sleep and are affordable (displayed in the image below).</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/mattress.jpg?width=508&amp;name=mattress.jpg\" alt=\"side by side image of woman sitting on cocoon by sealy mattress and empty casper mattress\" width=\"508\" style=\"width: 508px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.cocoonbysealy.com/Casper/?gclid=Cj0KCQiA1pyCBhCtARIsAHaY_5e1ATbxd1aRJr9KF0juKca2J7ijA-ew5BDkAd2FzjCYbQ806nqgpVMaAtc1EALw_wcB\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<h3>Adidas</h3> \n<p>Adidas is a well-known sports apparel brand that is only outshined by Nike. Adidas created a comparative video (shown below) that features a person running in the desert wearing Nike shoes.</p> \n<p>Runners know outdoor terrains are challenging to run in. Still, the most impressive thing in the video is that the cameraman carrying a 50-pound camera can keep up with the runner because he’s wearing Adidas shoes.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 200px; max-height: 150px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 75%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"200\" height=\"150\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/8TnG7jyfoWI?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>Kroger</h3> \n<p>Kroger is a grocery store chain that took out a full-page comparative advertisement against a local competitor (Publix) in a Tennessee newspaper.</p> \n<p>The advertisement, shown in the image below, features two long receipts from both stores that are the same length, but costs were cheaper, and savings were higher at Kroger. The brand essentially says that, even if you buy the same products, Kroger offers lower prices, savings, and additional perks that consumers cannot find at Publix.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/kroger-vs-publix.jpg?width=380&amp;name=kroger-vs-publix.jpg\" width=\"380\" style=\"width: 380px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://couponsinthenews.com/2012/08/26/grocery-stores-tussle-in-tennessee/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<h3>Bounty</h3> \n<p>Bounty is a paper towel brand that created a comparative ad to display the benefits of using their paper towels versus the leading generic brand. While they don’t explicitly name a competitor, they make a dig at whoever it may be by calling them the “ordinary brand” because they can’t clean up messes as well as Bounty can.</p> \n<p>Essentially, they’re saying Bounty is premium, and any other option is just regular.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/bounty-ad.jpg?width=418&amp;name=bounty-ad.jpg\" alt=\"bounty paper towel comparative advertisement that reads &quot;2x more absorbent so you can use less.&quot;\" width=\"418\" style=\"width: 418px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://swipefile.com/bounty-paper-towel-comparison-ad/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a><span style=\"font-style: italic;\">&nbsp;</span></p> \n<p>While all of these businesses used comparative advertising, it’s essential to understand that it’s only that — comparative. Each company believes it is the best option, but they say that through comparison, not false or misleading claims.</p> \n<p>However, given that the line can be vague, many countries have laws that dictate how comparative ads can and can’t be used.</p> \n<h2>Comparative Advertising Law</h2> \n<p>Below, we’ll discuss the comparative advertising laws from three different countries and the explicit language they use to explain what advertisers are allowed to do.</p> \n<h3>United States Comparative Advertising Law</h3> \n<p>The U.S.’s Federal Trade Commission (FTC) protects consumers from being deceived, defrauded, and manipulated by businesses. It also protects companies from unfair practices and activities of competitors.</p> \n<p>The FTC <a href=\"https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/16/14.15\">ruled on comparative advertising</a>&nbsp;and said, “Comparative advertising, when truthful and nondeceptive, is a source of important information to consumers and assists them in making rational purchase decisions. Comparative advertising encourages product improvement and innovation, and can lead to lower prices in the marketplace.”</p> \n<p>In brief, the FTC supports comparative advertising, as it benefits consumers by giving a well-rounded view of product offerings. What they don’t tolerate is advertising that disparages competitors and is deceptive as a means to get consumers to do business with one company over another. Companies can use the FTC ruling to file claims if they feel as though they are being discredited.</p> \n<h3>Australia Comparative Advertising Law</h3> \n<p>The <a href=\"https://www.accc.gov.au/accc-book/printer-friendly/29527\">Australian Competition and Consumer Commission</a>&nbsp;says that “Businesses may use comparative advertising to directly promote the superiority of their products over another.” Like U.S. law, businesses must follow general advertising best-practices of not being deceptive or misleading in an attempt to entice consumers to do business with them.</p> \n<h3>Hong Kong Comparative Advertising Law</h3> \n<p>Hong Kong has no specific legislation intended to limit comparative advertising. Still, the Trade Descriptions Ordinance <a href=\"https://www.elegislation.gov.hk/hk/cap362?p0=1&amp;p1=1\">prohibits false trade descriptions</a>&nbsp;and misleading or incomplete information advertisements, and the Association of Accredited Advertising Agencies of Hong Kong <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparative_advertising#Hong_Kong\">has the authority to investigate</a>&nbsp;instances of violation.</p> \n<p>All in all, regardless of your location, it’s important to understand the laws and regulations of comparative advertisements, so you don’t find yourself in the middle of a lawsuit.</p> \n<h2>Comparative Advertising Pros and Cons</h2> \n<p>The reality of choosing to use comparative advertising is up to your individual business needs.</p> \n<p>Suppose you have an industry competitor that owns most of the market share. In that case, comparative advertising can be beneficial as you’re letting your target market know that there are other options out there. If you’re a new business, comparative advertising can also help generate awareness around the fact that you exist.</p> \n<p>However, if you’re unable to support your claims of superiority and your advertisements seem more berating than comparative, you can stand to lose business. Overall, as mentioned above, the decision to use comparative advertising depends on your goals.</p> \n<p>We’ve compiled a list of comparative advertising pros and cons that will help you make a comprehensive decision about whether you should opt to use the strategy.</p> \n<table style=\"border-color: #99acc2; border-collapse: collapse; table-layout: fixed; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"> \n <tbody> \n  <tr> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Pros</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p>Cons</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Explicit product emphasis.</p> <p>Comparative advertising specifically focuses on a single product or feature that makes you better than a competitor, which is helpful advertising for your products in general.</p> <p>Even if you don’t sway your audience, they are still becoming aware of its direct specifications, benefits, and features.</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">You can face legal action.</p> <p>As mentioned above, many countries have laws protecting consumers and other businesses from comparative ads.</p> <p>If you don’t follow legal requirements, you may face legal action from your competitors that requires significant legal fees. If you’re a big name brand, publications will likely report on it, which can also negatively impact your reputation.</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Raise awareness.</p> <p>Comparative marketing can help you raise awareness for your business, especially if you’re new to the industry or a small business standing up to a competitor.</p> <p>Mentioning their name gives you exposure to their market share and an entirely new audience that may be ready to make the switch.</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Can create brand name confusion.</p> <p>Just as comparative ads can generate brand awareness, they can also spur confusion.</p> <p>Mentions of multiple competitors in the same ad can lead consumers to become confused about which business offers the features they prefer or which company proved to be the best option to meet their needs.</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Gain new followers and attract new clients.</p> <p>Comparative advertising can help you gain new followers and attract new clients, primarily when these ads are widely distributed and placed in high-volume consumer traffic areas.</p> <p>For example, many businesses in the United States create humorous comparative advertisements to share during the Super Bowl because they know the event has significant viewership.</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">You may lose integrity and look bad to your audience.</p> <p>Suppose your advertisements don’t align with your countries comparative advertising rules and are flat-out disparaging of your competitors. In that case, you may look bad to your target audience, which is the opposite effect you’re trying to have.</p> <p>In addition, even if you follow the laws, some people just don’t appreciate ads that pit two companies against each other. It’s best to first understand your target audience before electing to create and share comparative advertisements.</p> </td> \n  </tr> \n  <tr> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"> <p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Inform consumers about what is important.</p> <p>As comparative ads focus on a specific feature or experience that comes with a product or service, you're informing consumers about the factors they should keep in mind when making purchasing decisions.</p> <p>Essentially, you’re showing them that they should consider more than just the brand name of the product they’re interested in.</p> </td> \n   <td style=\"border: 1pt solid #000000;\" colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\">&nbsp;</td> \n  </tr> \n </tbody> \n</table> \n<h2>Comparative Advertising Can Help Your Business Grow</h2> \n<p>Should you opt to use it as part of your business’ marketing strategy, be mindful of comparative advertising laws in your country, ensure that you’re providing benefit to the consumer, and that you’re not simply disparaging your competitor and claiming superiority.</p> \n<p>If done successfully, you can stand to raise significant brand awareness, drive revenue, and even capture a higher portion of your industry <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-calculate-market-share?_ga=2.228893660.1342203147.1615561491-1046125508.1615561491\">market share</a>&nbsp;and position yourself as an industry leader.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=46d72524-f4a7-44e9-9af0-935be9bb3891&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"advertising plan\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/46d72524-f4a7-44e9-9af0-935be9bb3891.png\"></a></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fcomparative-advertising&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 30 Mar 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08.png","linkMd5":"10364029ebb8e04a897a90cb045d8039","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn14@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-30-559_91a8856cb36791e3.webp","destWidth":427,"destHeight":60,"sourceBytes":3972,"destBytes":6552,"author":"fneedle@hubspot.com (Flori Needle)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/da1bfbbd-7ee9-4bf1-89d1-6d7a833deb08.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn14@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-30-559_91a8856cb36791e3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/casper%20serp.jpg?width=495&name=casper%20serp.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn15@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-58-026_42b83eae8d368407.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/mattress.jpg?width=508&name=mattress.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn5@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-53-226_da924ecd23272dc1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/kroger-vs-publix.jpg?width=380&name=kroger-vs-publix.jpg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/bounty-ad.jpg?width=418&name=bounty-ad.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn46@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-50-01-842_31f90d775d6c90f8.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/46d72524-f4a7-44e9-9af0-935be9bb3891.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn25@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-59-800_8e21eaa098288b31.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fcomparative-advertising&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn59@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-50-00-588_5f0256717430a377.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370003},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"How To Use Hashtags on LinkedIn [Step-by-Step Guide]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/use-hashtags-on-linkedin","description":"<p>Even though LinkedIn has been around since 2003, the platform didn't allow the use of clickable hashtags until 2016.</p>  \n<p>Social media platforms like <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/twitter-for-business?_ga=2.84882971.341672752.1613784324-2055646440.1613784324\">Twitter </a>and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-hashtags\">Instagram </a>have encouraged hashtag use for years as a way for users to connect with their communities. They even offer analytics, allowing content creators and influencers to gauge their impact.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=ddd33609-1733-44d2-a811-a5435b201ffe&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Get the essential guide to using LinkedIn for marketing and professional  networking.\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ddd33609-1733-44d2-a811-a5435b201ffe.png\"></a></p> \n<p>Now that LinkedIn has fully embraced the use of hashtags, brands can too.</p> \n<p>Let's get into the basics of using hashtags on the platform and dive into how to find the top trending ones in your industry.</p> \n<h2>Do hashtags work on LinkedIn?</h2> \n<p>Yes, hashtags do work on LinkedIn. You can add them to your status update, your published article, and your business page to reach an audience beyond your network. You can also browse through hashtag feeds to see what conversations are happening surrounding those topics.</p> \n<h3>How To Use Hashtags on Your LinkedIn Status Update</h3> \n<p>There are a few ways to add hashtags to your status update.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"GIF showing how to add LinkedIn hashtag to status update\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-1.gif?width=448&amp;name=How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-1.gif\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 448px;\" title=\"\" width=\"448\"></p> \n<p>As the GIF illustrates, you can add a hashtag by:</p> \n<ol start=\"1\"> \n <li>Typing out the pound sign followed by the word or phrase. As you type out your hashtag, LinkedIn will auto-generate hashtag suggestions based on what's trending and popular.</li> \n <li>Clicking on the \"Add Hashtag\" button located on the bottom left of the box.</li> \n <li>Selecting one of the related hashtags next to the \"Add Hashtag\" button.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>Pro-tip: Don't add spaces or symbols in your hashtags, as they will no longer be clickable.</p> \n<h3>How To Use Hashtags on Your LinkedIn Article</h3> \n<p>As it currently stands, users cannot add clickable hashtags in the body of their articles published on LinkedIn. However, they can make it discoverable by adding hashtags to the article description box.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"GIF showing how to add a hashtag to an article on LinkedIn\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-2.gif?width=624&amp;height=332&amp;name=How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-2.gif\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\" height=\"332\"></p> \n<h3>How To Use Hashtags on Your Business Page</h3> \n<p>If you have a business page on LinkedIn, you can associate it with relevant hashtags. This will put you right in the center of conversations surrounding those hashtags and allow you to connect with relevant audiences. Here are the steps to add them:</p> \n<ol start=\"1\"> \n <li> <h4>Start on your business page's homepage.<img alt=\"LinkedIn business page homepage\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn.png?width=624&amp;name=How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\"></h4> </li> \n <li> <h4>Click on the \"Add\" button on the bottom right under \"Hashtags.\" A smaller page will open up.</h4> <img alt=\"LinkedIn page where users can add three hashtags related to their business page \" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-3.png?width=624&amp;name=How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-3.png\" title=\"\" width=\"624\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></li> \n <li> <h4>Click \"Add a hashtag\" and select up to three hashtags.</h4> <img alt=\"Example of three hashtags LinkedIn users can put on their business page\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-2.png?width=624&amp;name=How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-2.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\"><span style=\"font-size: 1.125rem; font-weight: 400;\">You're all set.</span></li> \n</ol> \n<h2>Should I use hashtags on LinkedIn?</h2> \n<p>The short answer is yes, hashtags are a great way to reach audiences beyond your direct connections on LinkedIn.</p> \n<p>Let's say you only have 200 connections on LinkedIn. You publish an article on SEO and don't use any hashtags. For it to make a substantial impact, you'll need a lot of post engagement from second- and third-degree connections.</p> \n<p>Why place such limits on <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/linkedin-content-marketing\">your content</a>? By using hashtags, you maximize your post's reach potential. If the SEO hashtag has 100,000K followers and you use it, your post engagement can easily triple what it was without hashtags.</p> \n<p>With that said, here are a few things to keep in mind when using them:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Don't go overboard </strong>– LinkedIn's former senior director of product management, Pete Davies, recommends <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/whats-your-linkedin-feed-people-you-know-talking-things-pete-davies/\">sticking to three hashtags</a>. That should be enough to target the main keywords without looking spammy.</li> \n <li><strong>Hashtags don't replace </strong><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/good-copywriting-practices-list\">copy </a></strong>– Hashtags don't provide context, they should only be used to improve your discoverability. You should still have descriptions in everything you post.</li> \n <li><strong>Mix the popular with the niche </strong>– When you only use popular hashtags, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/23454/the-ultimate-cheat-sheet-for-mastering-linkedin.aspx\">your content</a> can get lost. If you go too niche, you may not reach enough people. Using a little bit of both strikes the perfect balance.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Once you get comfortable with the use of hashtags, you can start identifying which ones are performing the best. You may find that some lead to higher engagement rates than others. If so, those are worth reusing.</p> \n<h2>How to Find Top LinkedIn Hashtags</h2> \n<p>There are three types of hashtags that LinkedIn recommends to its users based on their network and industry: recommended, popular, trending. LinkedIn's 'Discover More' page is the first – and best – place to look when considering which hashtags to use in your posts.</p> \n<p>To access this page, follow these steps:</p> \n<ol start=\"1\"> \n <li>Click on the \"Discover More\" button. \n  <ul> \n   <li>On the mobile app, this will appear when you click on your profile picture on the top left corner of the page.</li> \n   <li>On desktop view, it will be at the bottom of the left sidebar.</li> \n  </ul> </li> \n <li>On this page, you'll see trending pages, recommended connections and pages, and hashtags toward the bottom of the page.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>As a marketer, LinkedIn recommends me many marketing-related hashtags, such as #digitalmarketing, #seo, and #contentwriter. However, this list will vary from one user to the next.</p> \n<h2>LinkedIn Trending Hashtags</h2> \n<p>In 2020, LinkedIn released data on the top trending hashtags for Q1 in 2020.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"LinkedIn top trending hashtags in 2020\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-1.png?width=624&amp;name=How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn-1.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://about.linkedin.com/content/dam/me/business/en-us/resource-hub/linkedIn-3.30-content-insights-infographic.pdf\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>In January and February, the list was virtually identical. However, conversations shifted in March when the pandemic started. Searches for topics on remote working tripled and the #remotework hashtag also started trending.</p> \n<p>The best way to optimize your hashtag use is by referring to your recommended hashtags and analyzing their performance on your posts.</p> \n<h2>How To Follow Hashtags on LinkedIn</h2> \n<p>Following hashtags will allow you to see what other content creators are posting, how users are responding, and get ideas for future posts.</p> \n<ol start=\"1\"> \n <li>Head to the search bar and type the hashtag you want to follow.</li> \n <li>Select an option from the dropdown menu.</li> \n <li>That will take you to the hashtag's feed where you can see all content published with this hashtag. Click \"Follow\" at the top of the page.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>See the GIF below to see the steps in action.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"GIF showing how to follow hashtags on LinkedIn\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20To%20Use%20Hashtags%20on%20LinkedIn.gif\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p>Now that you're following the hashtag, you'll see it on the left sidebar under \"Followed Hashtags\" when navigating on a computer. When using the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/linkedin-stats\">LinkedIn </a>mobile app, you can access the hashtags you're following by clicking on your profile picture on the top left of the window and scrolling down to the \"Followed Hashtags\" dropdown menu.</p> \n<p>Hashtags are integral to the success of your content. By relying on LinkedIn's hashtag recommendations and your analytics, you can ensure your posts are reaching the right audience.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b612a0dc-34ea-4e79-908b-28874def7e5a&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"How to Use LinkedIn for Business and Marketing\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b612a0dc-34ea-4e79-908b-28874def7e5a.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fuse-hashtags-on-linkedin&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\"
