\">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 01 Apr 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/e9d2eacb-6b01-423a-bf7a-19d42ba77eaa.png","linkMd5":"75512b3b93cdb33313246eaf51cfffd2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn100@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-30-711_8ff1ce58a24f6d9c.webp","destWidth":428,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":4856,"destBytes":6606,"author":"Rebecca Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/e9d2eacb-6b01-423a-bf7a-19d42ba77eaa.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn100@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-30-711_8ff1ce58a24f6d9c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Plain%20English%20Guide%20to%20Writing%20a%20Business%20Case.png?width=600&name=The%20Plain%20English%20Guide%20to%20Writing%20a%20Business%20Case.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn85@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-53-197_9269671074b1013a.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9ce704de-19f2-4fd0-8041-22dc3c021b87.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn41@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-51-604_ec9e2c896a128892.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbusiness-case&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn84@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-51-548_8f7c1be0d410338d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370058},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"How to Use Facebook for Business: 25 Facebook Marketing Tips and Tricks","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/24422/the-ultimate-facebook-marketing-cheat-sheet.aspx","description":"<p>Although some of the younger demographics are passing up Facebook in favor of tools like Instagram and Snapchat, Facebook still dominates the market.</p> \n<p>With <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/346167/facebook-global-dau/\">1.85 billion people</a> logging in daily (a 16% increase year-over-year), it's still the most popular social network around. Not to mention, Facebook owns <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/265773/market-share-of-the-most-popular-social-media-websites-in-the-us/\">60% of all social logins</a>.</p> \n<p>If you want your business' content to reach consumers, having a presence on Facebook is a given. But to make the <em>most</em> of your Facebook Page -- to attract and engage visitors, drive them to your website, and convert them into leads (and, eventually, customers) -- you need to optimize your Facebook presence.<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=9f7c45b7-c71b-4797-8d5d-e6b296fb6a83&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Free Resource: How to Reach &amp; Engage Your Audience on Facebook\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9f7c45b7-c71b-4797-8d5d-e6b296fb6a83.png\" /></a></p> \n<p>We know that learning all the nuances of various social networks can be a tricky and time-consuming feat, especially considering how frequently they add, remove, and modify features.</p> \n<p>To help you stay ahead of the curve, we've put together a handy cheat sheet that businesses can use to make the most of <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/facebook-marketing\">Facebook marketing</a>. The list is divided into three main categories depending on your goals for using Facebook:</p> \n<ol> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/24422/the-ultimate-facebook-marketing-cheat-sheet.aspx#tips-facebook-business-page\">Tips for Your Facebook Business Page</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/24422/the-ultimate-facebook-marketing-cheat-sheet.aspx#tips-for-news-feed-visibility\">Tips for News Feed Visibility</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/24422/the-ultimate-facebook-marketing-cheat-sheet.aspx#tips-for-advertising-on-facebook\">Tips for Advertising on Facebook</a></li> \n</ol> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/gu9Hgazn_5g\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<p></p> \n<p>Even with new social media platforms popping on the scene, Facebook is still the most popular social network. That's why it's important for your business to be on Facebook and use it to connect with your audience. With over a billion people on Facebook every day, your audience is probably on the site daily.</p> \n<p>So, how can you use this tool to connect with your audience? Let's dive in below.</p> \n<h3>How to Use Facebook for Marketing</h3> \n<h4>1. Engage with your audience.</h4> \n<p>Social media is best known for its ability to help you connect with your audience. On Facebook, you can enter direct conversations with your target audience through comments, reactions, and even messages. By engaging with your audience, you'll increase brand awareness and help tell your brand story.</p> \n<h4>2. Listen to your audience.</h4> \n<p>Now, when you're on social media, it's important that you don't just use the tool to talk at your audience without listening when they respond. To really leverage Facebook for marketing, you should use social media listening tools and track what people are saying. You can track mentions of your company and follow hashtags so you always know what's trending and going on with your customers.</p> \n<h4>3. Develop a contest and giveaway strategy.</h4> \n<p>A great way to use Facebook for your marketing purposes is to run contests and giveaways. Now before you dive in, make sure you develop a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-giveaway\">strategy</a>. What kinds of things will you giveaway? How will your audience participate? It's important to think this through and make sure your decision aligns with what your audience wants from you.</p> \n<h4>4. Promote your events.</h4> \n<p>Of course if you're running any online events, it's important to market that. Facebook is a great place to do that because you can create an event and invite your followers. This is a great way to get the word out about your events.</p> \n<h4>5. Use Facebook Ads.</h4> \n<p>Facebook actually might be most popular among businesses for its advanced ads tool. If you're running online ads, Facebook is one of the best places to do it.</p> \n<p>Now that you know how to use Facebook for business, let's dive into some tips and tricks to help you succeed.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>25 Tips and Tricks for Marketing on Facebook</h2> \n<pre><a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/facebook-marketing-training\">Learn Facebook Marketing in HubSpot Academy</a></pre> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Tips for Your Facebook Business Page</h3> \n<h4>1. Create a business Page, not a personal profile.</h4> \n<p>First thing's first: You need to create a business Page -- <em>not</em> a personal profile -- to represent your brand. Pages look similar to personal profiles, but they include unique tools for businesses, brands, and organizations. Your fans can Like your Page to see updates from you in their News Feeds, which is something they can't do for personal profiles.</p> \n<p>Not only will this maximize Facebook's business potential for you, but it's actually against <a class=\"_5dwo\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/legal/terms\">Facebook's Terms of Service</a> to use a personal account to represent something other than that person, like a business. If you've already created a profile for your business, you'll want to convert it into a business Page, which you can <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/help/116067818477568\">learn how to do easily here</a>.</p> \n<p>Setting up a page is simple. Just <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/pages/create\">visit this page</a> and follow the step-by-step setup instructions.</p> \n<h4>2. Claim your Page's vanity URL.</h4> \n<p>Once you've created your business Page, it'll get a randomly assigned number and URL, like facebook.com/pages/yourbusiness/123456789. To make your Page more shareable and easier to find, you'll want to create a recognizable vanity URL (e.g., <a href=\"http://www.facebook.com/hubspot\">http://www.facebook.com/hubspot</a>).</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">To create a vanity URL, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/username/\">visit this page</a>, then follow the instructions.</p> \n<h4>3. Add a great cover photo.</h4> \n<p>Facebook's page design lets you feature a 820 x 312 pixel cover photo at the top of your business Page. You'll want to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-cover-photos-best-practices-ht\">optimize that cover photo</a> to capture the attention of new visitors, encourage them to explore and learn more, and provide an effective mobile experience -- all the while ensuring you're following Facebook's <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/page_guidelines.php\">Page Guidelines</a>.</p> \n<p>Learn all about do's and don'ts for your Facebook cover photo <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-cover-photos-best-practices-ht\">in this blog post</a>.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/jcrew-facebook-cover-photo.png?width=690&amp;height=300&amp;name=jcrew-facebook-cover-photo.png\" alt=\"J Crew Facebook cover photo.\" title=\"jcrew-facebook-cover-photo.png\" width=\"690\" height=\"300\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/twitter-header-image-examples#sm.0000o5c3iom8gdkipdw2l236rj19q\" title=\"awesome examples of business page cover photos\">Here are some more awesome examples of business Page cover photos </a> to get your creative juices flowing.</p> \n<h4>4. Add a recognizable profile picture.</h4> \n<p>Pick a profile picture that will be easy for visitors to recognize -- like your company logo, or a headshot of yourself if you're a solopreneur or consultant. Being recognizable is important for getting found and Liked, especially in Facebook Search. Your profile image is pictured at the top of your Facebook Page and is also the thumbnail image that gets displayed next to all your Facebook Page updates, so choose wisely.</p> \n<p>When choosing a photo, keep in mind that Facebook requires your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ultimate-guide-social-media-image-dimensions-infographic\">profile picture dimensions</a> to be 170 pixels by 170 pixels.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/makr-facebook-profile-photo.png?width=690&amp;height=300&amp;name=makr-facebook-profile-photo.png\" alt=\"Makr Facebook profile picture.\" title=\"makr-facebook-profile-photo.png\" width=\"690\" height=\"300\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<h4>5. Optimize your \"About\" section -- especially the preview.</h4> \n<p>Your \"About\" section is one of the first places people will look when they arrive on your Page. A preview of it is located on the left-hand side of your page beneath your profile picture, and people can also navigate to the full section by clicking on the \"About\" tab at the top of your page.</p> \n<p>Be sure to optimize the preview section on the left side of your page with brief yet descriptive copy to give visitors a sense of what your Page and your business is about before they decide to Like you. This copy will get pulled from the \"Short Description\" you provide within your full \"About\" tab.</p> \n<p>Here's an example video marketing software company <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/wistia/\">Wistia</a>:</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/wistia-about-preview-facebook.png?width=314&amp;height=172&amp;name=wistia-about-preview-facebook.png\" alt=\"Wistia Facebook about preview.\" title=\"wistia-about-preview-facebook.png\" width=\"314\" height=\"172\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p>And another from a restaurant called <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/TahazaHummusKitchen/\">Tahaza Hummus Kitchen</a>:</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/tahaza-about-preview-facebook.png?width=318&amp;height=367&amp;name=tahaza-about-preview-facebook.png\" alt=\"Tahaza Hummus Kitchen about preview on Facebook.\" title=\"tahaza-about-preview-facebook.png\" width=\"318\" height=\"367\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p>To edit your own \"About\" tab, click on it, hover over the section you'd like to edit, and click the pencil icon.</p> \n<h4>6. Earn the \"Very responsive to messages\" badge.</h4> \n<p>If you respond quickly to most users who send you messages on Facebook, then you can earn what Facebook calls a \"Very responsive to messages\" badge. You'll earn a <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/help/www/475643069256244\">\"Very responsive to messages\" badge</a> below your Page's cover photo if you have a response rate of 90% and a response time of 15 minutes over the last seven days.</p> \n<p>If you're responsive to messages but haven't quite earned the badge, Facebook will still show off how responsive you are to visitors. Here's an example <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/zappos/\">from Zappos' Page</a>:</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/zappos-about-preview-facebook-1.png?width=311&amp;height=132&amp;name=zappos-about-preview-facebook-1.png\" alt=\"Zappos response rate on Facebook.\" title=\"zappos-about-preview-facebook-1.png\" width=\"311\" height=\"132\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p>If you're not very responsive to messages, nothing will appear. So, while it's not the end of the world if you don't respond, having that badge lets users know your business is listening and cares about their needs.</p> \n<p>By the way, there's a lot you can do with <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/marketing/messenger\">Facebook's \"Messenger\" tool for businesses</a>. We recommend you explore and make the most out of Facebook as a communication and support tool.</p> \n<h4>7. Add milestones.</h4> \n<p>The \"Milestones\" feature lets you highlight some of your business' biggest accomplishments, like award wins, product releases, major events, or other accolades. Recent milestones will be posted to your Timeline, and users will be able to find them later under your \"About\" tab.</p> \n<p>To add milestones, click on the \"Timeline\" section of your Page, and click the \"Offer, Event +\" option in the page update composer near the top of your page.</p> \n<h4>9. Choose a call-to-action button.</h4> \n<p>Facebook's option to place a simple call-to-action button at the top of your Facebook Page is another handy feature. You can <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-cta-button#sm.0000o5c3iom8gdkipdw2l236rj19q\">learn how to add a CTA button to your business' Facebook Page here</a>.</p> \n<p>You can choose from seven pre-made button options (\"Sign Up,\" \"Shop Now,\" \"Contact Us,\" \"Book Now,\" \"Use App,\" Watch Video,\" and \"Play Game\") and link it to any website that aligns with your business' goals. It could link to your homepage, a landing page, a contact sheet, a video, or somewhere else.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/dollar-shave-club-facebook-page-cta.png?width=690&amp;height=299&amp;name=dollar-shave-club-facebook-page-cta.png\" alt=\"Dollar Shave Club Facebook CTA\" title=\"dollar-shave-club-facebook-page-cta.png\" width=\"690\" height=\"299\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<h4>10. Create custom page tabs.</h4> \n<p>By default, your page tabs are set as Timeline, About, Photos, Likes and More. But Facebook lets you create and leverage custom tabs -- which are basically like landing pages within your Facebook Page, or calls-to-action where you can feature anything from case studies to marketing offers to other promotions you're running.</p> \n<p>They're right at the top of your page and let you give visitors specific path to do what you want them to do on your Page. For example, if you're hiring a lot of people, you might create a custom tab for \"Jobs\" that links to your jobs site, like <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/zendesk/\">Zendesk does on their Page</a>:</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/zendesk-facebook-jobs-tab.png?width=550&amp;name=zendesk-facebook-jobs-tab.png\" alt=\"Zendesk Facebook jobs tab.\" title=\"zendesk-facebook-jobs-tab.png\" width=\"550\" style=\"width: 550px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p>You can create custom tabs by signing in, visiting your Page, clicking the \"More\" tab and choosing \"Manage Tabs\" from the dropdown menu.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Tips for News Feed Visibility</h3> \n<h4>11. Prioritize quality over quantity.</h4> \n<p>Here are two questions we hear a lot: <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-post-frequency-benchmarks\">How often should I post to Facebook</a>? Will posting more frequently will help me reach more people?</p> \n<p>In short, the answer is no. At the end of the day, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-algorithm-works-facebook-twitter-instagram\">how visible your posts are in people's News Feeds</a> all comes down to the quality of your posts. These algorithms are meant to filter out the irrelevant and the poor quality posts so that the highest-quality stuff is what gets through and gets shown to users.</p> \n<p>So don't overwhelm your customers with content on Facebook, and be selective about what you're publishing. Spend more time <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/create-perfect-social-media-posts-slideshare\">crafting <em>better</em> Facebook posts</a>, and less time crafting a lot of Facebook posts. Remember: It's a marketer's job to post content to social that's interesting, entertaining, helpful, and/or relevant to the audience. This means picking relevant topics, writing delightful copy, and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/visual-content-marketing-strategy\">posting compelling images and videos</a>.</p> \n<h4>12. Post at the best times for your audience.</h4> \n<p>Another common question: <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-times-post-pin-tweet-social-media-infographic\">When’s the best time to post to Facebook</a>? Unfortunately, there's no perfect answer -- different businesses may find different days and times work best for them. Timing often depends on what your target audience uses Facebook for, the region(s) you're targeting, the content of your post (e.g. funny or serious), and your goals (e.g. clicks versus shares), and so on.</p> \n<p>That being said, <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/insights/best-times-to-post-on-social-media/\">there is data out there on optimal times to post on Facebook</a>:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>The best time to post on Facebook is Wednesday, 11 a.m. and 1–2 p.m. Other optimal times include Tuesday through Thursday, 8 a.m.–3 p.m.</li> \n <li>The worst times to post on Facebook on Sundays, or every day either before 7 a.m. or after 5 p.m.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Think of this data as a general guideline, and use it to help you find the optimal posting times for your business.</p> \n<h4>13. Post your best blog content.</h4> \n<p>For businesses, social media continues to be driven by content. It's a marketer's job to post content to social that's interesting, entertaining, helpful, and/or relevant to our audience. Start populating your Page's timeline with content by handpicking your best, most helpful blog posts.</p> \n<p>If you're strapped for resources but maintain a business blog, you can try connecting your blog to auto-post links to new blog content you publish. Many blogging platforms (like <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/free-trial-social-media-tools\" title=\"HubSpot\">HubSpot) </a>automatically offer this feature within the software -- you'll just need to turn it on and sync it with your Page. You don't want to put too much emphasis on automation, though. It's OK to auto-publish <em>some </em>content, but make sure a real human is posting and engaging with your fans, too.</p> \n<h4>14. Make sure your blog posts' meta descriptions are complete.</h4> \n<p>Have you noticed that when you post a link to Facebook, it pulls in a brief description as well as an image?</p> \n<p>The description gets pulled from <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/meta-descriptions\">the page's meta description</a>, which refers to the HTML attribute that explains the contents of a given web page. It's the short description you see on a search engine results page to \"preview\" what the page is about, and it's also the copy Facebook will automatically pull in the populate the description of a post.</p> \n<p>Without a meta description, Facebook may pull in the first text they can find, which doesn't make for a very good user experience. Plus, meta descriptions are your chance to sell your visitors on what you have to offer: informative, valuable content.</p> \n<p>Your meta description should be compelling enough to get people to click, and it should be <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/character-limit-social-media-blog-posts#Blog\">155 characters or fewer</a> in length. <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-meta-description-ht\">Read this blog post</a> to learn more about writing effective meta descriptions.</p> \n<h4>15. Remove links from your post copy.</h4> \n<p>Keep your copy succinct by removing the horrendously long URL you're sharing from the text in your post.</p> \n<p>Your post real estate is precious, and you want to ensure any characters employed are purely for the sake of sparking a reader's attention. Plus, any user can click on the generated thumbnail or title for that URL to navigate to the blog post, web page, or any URL you're linking to -- so no need to include it in the copy of your post as well.</p> \n<h4>16. Post your most compelling visual content.</h4> \n<p>Facebook's timeline page design places more of an emphasis on visual content like images and videos. After all, Facebook posts with images see <a href=\"http://buzzsumo.com/blog/how-to-massively-boost-your-blog-traffic-with-these-5-awesome-image-stats/\">2.3X more engagement</a> than posts without images. <a href=\"http://www.emarketer.com/Article/Photos-Cluttering-Your-Facebook-Feed-Herersquos-Why/1010777\">One study found</a> that Facebook posts with photos saw the most engagement over any other type of post, accounting for a whopping 87% of total interactions.</p> \n<p>That's why posting compelling visual content is one of the most important things you can do to improve your Facebook strategy. Use this to your advantage <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/shareable-visual-content\">posting your best visual content to your Facebook Page</a>, or making more of an effort to make the content you already create more visual. (<a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/templates-shareable-graphics-social-media\">Click here to download 50 social media image templates for free</a>.)</p> \n<p>A successful social strategy will often include photos, videos, and screenshots of infographics or other graphs. In addition to being fun to look at, it's important that your visual content be compelling and relevant to your audience.</p> \n<p>Another reason to post lots of visual content? It'll help auto-populate the \"Photos\" and \"Videos\" tabs, which are automatically added to every Facebook Page. You want those to be rife with visual content when people click on them.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/cisco-facebook-photos-tab.png?width=500&amp;name=cisco-facebook-photos-tab.png\" alt=\"Cisco Facebook photos tab.\" title=\"cisco-facebook-photos-tab.png\" width=\"500\" style=\"width: 500px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<h4>17. Make sure your images are properly formatted.</h4> \n<p>Don't just post images for the sake of posting images. To give your users the best experience possible, you need to optimize your images for Facebook so that they're the right sizes and dimensions. (<a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-cover-photos\">Click here to download pre-sized cover photo templates for Facebook and other social networks for free</a>.)</p> \n<p>Below are a few of the most common Facebook image sizes, but <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ultimate-guide-social-media-image-dimensions-infographic#sm.0000o5c3iom8gdkipdw2l236rj19q\">you can find a more detailed guide here</a>.</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Cover photo: 820 px wide by 312 px tall</li> \n <li>Profile image: 170 px wide by 170 px tall</li> \n <li>Shared image: 1200 px wide by 630 px tall</li> \n <li>Shared link thumbnail image: 1200 px wide by 627 px tall</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>18. Post videos, especially live videos.</h4> \n<p>The folks at Facebook know that people like watching videos on Facebook. The number of people watching video content is rapidly increasing. In fact, there are more than <a href=\"https://www.omnicoreagency.com/facebook-statistics/\">4 billion video views</a> on Facebook every day.</p> \n<p>Facebook is continuing to tweak <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-algorithm-works-facebook-twitter-instagram\">how the algorithm measures people's interest</a> in video content on Facebook, but the main takeaway is to make your videos as visually engaging as possible -- especially in the first few seconds.</p> \n<p>Why? Because although all videos on Facebook autoplay in people's News Feeds, they're on mute until the viewer manually turns the volume on. The more visually engaging your video, the more you can entice people to stick around. Getting people to spend more time watching your video will help your video rank higher in the News Feed because to Facebook, signs of user engagement with a video include spending time watching the video, turning on the audio, switching to full-screen mode, or enabling high definition.</p> \n<p>In their continued effort to promote video content in the News Feed, Facebook <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-live-guide\">launched Facebook Live</a>, a live video streaming service that lets anyone broadcast live videos from their mobile device straight to their Facebook News Feed.</p> \n<h4>19. Use <a href=\"http://www.facebook.com/insights\">Facebook Insights</a>.</h4> \n<p>Facebook Insights is Facebook's internal analytics tool right that helps you measure and analyze your Facebook presence. The tool provides Facebook page administrators with analytics data about Page visits and engagement, which can help you understand which content is and isn't engaging to your fans.</p> \n<p><a href=\"http://www.facebook.com/insights\">Access your page's Insights here</a>, or by clicking into the 'Admin Panel' on your Page. We've also published an <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/31965/How-to-Analyze-Facebook-Insights-to-Improve-Your-Content-Strategy-With-Video.aspx\" title=\"informative blog post and video\"> informative blog post and video </a> that walk you through how to analyze Facebook Insights to improve your content strategy.</p> \n<h4>20. Schedule posts in advance.</h4> \n<p>Scrambling for Facebook content is not a new phenomenon. We have meetings. We run late. Things come up. That's why you'll want to use a third-party Facebook application like <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/free-trial-social-media-tools\" title=\"HubSpot's social media publishing tool\">HubSpot's social media publishing tool</a> to schedule your Facebook posts (and other social media posts) in advance.</p> \n<p>First, <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-content-calendar\">download our free social media content calendar template</a> to help plan your posts in advance. You can fill it in at the same day and time every single week to prep for the following week's social media content. Then, use that third-party Facebook application to actually schedule out your posts.</p> \n<p>However, just as we advised against too much Facebook automation with blog auto-posting, the same holds true for scheduling. Don't get caught in the trap of turning your page into a robot, and make sure you're actively engaging with your fans, too.</p> \n<h4>21. Add Facebook social media buttons to your blog and website.</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29544/The-Ultimate-Cheat-Sheet-for-Creating-Social-Media-Buttons.aspx#facebook\">Adding Facebook social media buttons</a> will help encourage visitors who are on your website to also connect and interact with you on Facebook, as well as spread your content and expand its reach.</p> \n<p>The Facebook Follow Button lets you expand your Facebook reach by making it easy for your site visitors to Like your business' Facebook Page with just one click. It displays your page's number of Likes, as well as faces of people who already like your page, using <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/32418/10-Ways-to-Instantly-Amplify-the-Social-Proof-of-Your-Marketing.aspx\">social proof</a> to amplify its effectiveness.</p> \n<p>The Facebook Like Box lets you promote your business' Facebook Page on your website and blog, highlight other users who have already Liked your page, display your follower count, and feature recent posts on your page. With just one click, people can Like your business Page -- without leaving your site.</p> \n<p>The Facebook Like Button lets people easily Like your content. When a user Likes a piece of content, it may show up in your friends' News Feeds because the algorithm takes it as a signal your friends will find it relevant.</p> \n<p>(Note: This button doesn't allow them to add personalized messages to links before sharing them. To allow users to add a personalized message, use the Facebook Share Button, explained below.)</p> \n<p>To customize your Facebook Like Button, <a href=\"https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/plugins/like/\">visit this page</a> and follow the instructions.</p> \n<p>Facebook Share Buttons act similarly to the Like Button by sharing your content on their Timeline and in friends' News Feeds, except they also let people add a comment or message to the link when sharing it.</p> \n<p>To generate a Facebook Share Button, <a href=\"https://developers.facebook.com/docs/plugins/share-button\">visit this page</a> and follow the instructions.</p> \n<h4>22. Subscribe to Facebook's Official Blog for future announcements from Facebook.</h4> \n<p>Give yourself a competitive edge by staying on top of the latest announcements from Facebook such as new features and tools by subscribing to the official <a href=\"http://blog.facebook.com/\" title=\"Facebook Blog\">Facebook Blog</a>.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Tips For Advertising on Facebook</h3> \n<h4>23. Choose the right advertising tool.</h4> \n<p>Facebook offers users the <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/ads/manager/creation\">Ads Manager</a>. Facebook's Ads Manager works great for most companies. Figure out which is best for your business based on your company size and the number of ads you plan to run at once.</p> \n<h4>24. Use Audience Insights to learn about your audience.</h4> \n<p>The best Facebook ads are high-quality, relevant ads that fit seamlessly into the user's environment on Facebook. Learn more about your customers and prospects using <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-audience-insights-guide\">Audience Insights</a>, which you can find inside the Facebook Ad Manager in the left-hand navigation.</p> \n<p>The tool will help you target your ads more effectively and learn about your audience -- even if you are not advertising to them. How? The data can help you <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33491/Everything-Marketers-Need-to-Research-Create-Detailed-Buyer-Personas-Template.aspx\">build stronger buyer personas</a>, create more compelling content, and uncover some gems for your competitive research.</p> \n<h4>25. Test multiple versions of a single ad.</h4> \n<p>Running a single campaign won't give you much to work with in terms of finding your audience, optimizing your ads, and determining if Facebook advertising works for your business. You need to be able and willing to run multiple campaigns to test and experiment with different parts of a single campaign.</p> \n<p>Test your targeting first, using a simple advertisement and basic image. In order to reach and test on a wider audience, you're going to have to invest a reasonable amount of money on your campaign. <a href=\"http://buzzsumo.com/blog/acquire-new-customers-social-media/\">The folks at BuzzSumo suggest</a> that number be in the thousands. The reason for this? Facebook ads reward you for testing more ads and targets. Whereas cost-per-click doesn't change much when you're advertising on Google or LinkedIn, <a href=\"http://www.convinceandconvert.com/social-media-strategy/facebook-case-studies/\">Facebook ads cost a lot less</a> if you're diligently testing them.</p> \n<p>Then, you can test the creative side of the ad, including images, headlines, and body text. Try testing 20–25 variations on your proven targets.</p> \n<p>Facebook is still a great tool for your business and it's important to figure out how it can work for your company.</p> \n<p>Want to learn more? <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-paid-ad-checklist\">Read this blog post to learn more about creating, optimizing, and analyzing your Facebook ads</a>.</p> \n<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b1ed53ce-abab-413f-b67a-846d53ac1657&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"generate leads with facebook\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1ed53ce-abab-413f-b67a-846d53ac1657.png\" /></a> \n<img 021/04/03/04-49-54-446_f64fc564428f4875.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1ed53ce-abab-413f-b67a-846d53ac1657.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn40@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-55-798_43149526df2d3104.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fblog%2Ftabid%2F6307%2Fbid%2F24422%2Fthe-ultimate-facebook-marketing-cheat-sheet.aspx&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn18@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-52-407_8cdc49e3b238b53f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370165},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"What Consumers Want to See on Company Websites [New Data]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/5521/chart-of-the-week-what-buyers-want-from-your-website.aspx","description":"<p>For many businesses, a website is undeniably critical for reaching new audiences — and is often the first impression someone will have of your brand.</p> \n<p>But having a website alone isn't enough to reach and convert new customers. It's equally vital that your <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing/website-strategy\">website is well-designed</a>, or you risk losing valuable leads.</p> \n<p>&nbsp;Website design plays a huge role for a few reasons: First, web design can impact your website's ability to rank on search engines for keywords related to your products or services. Additionally, web design can influence whether a user stays on your site once they find it.</p> \n<p>And, lastly, web design will ultimately impact how many leads and prospects you're able to convert into customers.</p> \n<p>Good website design always begins with the question, \"What is the main <em>action</em>&nbsp;we want someone to take when they visit our site?\"</p> \n<p>However, \"good\" website design can seem vague — what exactly do marketers mean when they say, \"That's an impressive website design\"?</p> \n<p>To uncover key design features you'll want to include in your website in 2021 and beyond, we asked 285 people around the U.S. which elements they feel are most important for a company website.</p> \n<p>Here are their responses.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=aacfe6c7-71e6-4f49-979f-76099062afa0&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: Free Marketing Plan Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/aacfe6c7-71e6-4f49-979f-76099062afa0.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/hubfs/Which%20element(s)%20are%20most%20important%20for%20a%20business%20website_.pdf\"><img alt=\"graph depicting the most important elements of a company website\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Consumers%20Want%20to%20See%20on%20Company%20Websites,%20According%20to%20Marketers%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png?width=624&amp;height=416&amp;name=What%20Consumers%20Want%20to%20See%20on%20Company%20Websites,%20According%20to%20Marketers%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\" height=\"416\"></a></p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/hubfs/Which%20element(s)%20are%20most%20important%20for%20a%20business%20website_.pdf?_ga=2.71012245.466989618.1615579045-1889142982.1615579045\">Click here for the PDF version of this graph.&nbsp;</a></p> \n<h3>1. According to 62% of those polled, including contact information on your website is critical.</h3> \n<p>Including contact information seems simple, but a lot of companies miss this. And it's undeniably important — in fact, those surveyed rated \"Contact Us Information\" as the most important element you can include on your company's website.</p> \n<p>You'll want to include the phone number, email address, or other contact medium you want people to reach you for sales inquiries — preferably in an easy-to-find location, like the header of the page.</p> \n<p>Also, consider including a clickable \"Email us!\" CTA that either opens an email client or links to your contact form. And, speaking of forms, you might want to embed \"Contact Us\" forms throughout your site. Visitors don't need to go on a scavenger hunt to find out how to get in touch with you.</p> \n<h3>2. 19% believe a blog is most important.</h3> \n<p>All digital, social, and other online marketing requires quality content. And a blog is one of the most effective opportunities you have to create and distribute high-quality content related to your products or services.</p> \n<p>Out of those surveyed, 19% believe it's actually the most important element on a business' website.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>To get maximum SEO benefit, your blog should be listed under your domain (something like www.yourcompany/blog) instead of off-site through a third-party service.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, a blog can help you reach new audiences, increase brand awareness, and convert prospects through educational, valuable content.</p> \n<h3>3. An About Us page is a vital element, and can help your brand share its story.</h3> \n<p>Sharing your story and highlighting core values is critical for your brand's long-term success. In fact, 85% of consumers say they'll only consider a brand&nbsp;if they <em>trust</em>&nbsp;the brand.</p> \n<p>As shown in the poll we conducted, an About Us page is the second-highest rated element, with 31% ruling an About Us page the most important element — overshadowing live chat, product images/video, and even case studies.</p> \n<p>Simply put, people care about who they do business with, so tell people who you are and why your work matters. That said, keep it brief. Customers don't have time to read a research paper.</p> \n<p>For About Us page inspiration, take a look at <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/remarkable-about-us-page-examples\">26 About Us &amp; About Me Pages + Templates to Make Your Own</a>.</p> \n<h3>4. You'll want to include social media icons to drive traffic to your social pages.</h3> \n<p>We know social media icons are important, but I was surprised to see this element overshadow live chat, customer case studies, and blog as the most important element of a company's website, according to 30% of those surveyed.</p> \n<p>Once your website is regularly bringing in traffic, it's important you link out to your social media pages so prospects and customers can follow you.</p> \n<p>However, it's important you don't overdo it — when in doubt, go for simplicity over scale. For instance, <a href=\"https://about.ads.microsoft.com/en-us/insights/g/consumer-trends-2021-report\">if you work for an ecommerce company</a>, consider linking to a few visually appealing pages, such as Instagram, Pinterest, or YouTube.</p> \n<p>Of course, don't add platforms that you don't update regularly. You're building trust, and that comes by regularly having updated and relevant content and answering queries from customers and leads.</p> \n<h3>5. According to 20% percent of those polled, customer testimonials can effectively take your website to the next level.</h3> \n<p>Potential customers need to trust you before choosing to work with you. Fortunately, customer <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/testimonial-page-examples\">testimonial pages</a>&nbsp;can help you effectively build that trust with prospects.</p> \n<p>Use your website to build your credibility by sharing your expertise and successful track record with clients and customers. When you do get testimonials, ask your clients for permission to use their real names. Real endorsements from recognizable businesses and organizations means a lot more than an anonymous testimonial or a&nbsp;quote from a&nbsp;fictional&nbsp;persona.</p> \n<p>Case study pages should have a consistent, concise format and template to explain what problem a customer had, how your company solved it, and what process you&nbsp;used&nbsp;to get to resolution.</p> \n<h3>6. Geographic details are invaluable for local search SEO.</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/local-seo\">46% of all Google searches are looking for local information</a>&nbsp;— which means if your business isn't optimized for local search, you could be missing out on potential customers who are searching for products or services within your geographical region.</p> \n<p>And, as shown in our research, 26% feel a business' physical location is a key component of an effective website.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>The pandemic has made many of us forget a physical world exists. Most businesses with brick-and-mortar locations rely on customers within a certain geographic area. Fortunately, when many people search for a product or service, they include a location. Including your location information will help your SEO strategy and help people unfamiliar with your region find your business.</p> \n<p>For instance, if you need a locksmith, you might search \"locksmith in Maplewood, NJ.\" This is why you should use your location in page titles and other metadata, as well as in the text that appears on your website. If you have several cities you serve, you should consider creating landing pages on your site for each location for easier navigation.</p> \n<h3>7. Live chat is an important element of a business' website&nbsp;in 2021.</h3> \n<p>According to 28% of our respondents, live chat is a necessary component of a successful website.</p> \n<p>Chatbots can't replace&nbsp;real people with customer service, but they <em>are</em>&nbsp;a good alternative for those who don't want to call or email and may be inquiring about services or simple FAQs. To meet customers where they are and provide the instant feedback they require, consider installing a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customers-want-live-chat\">live chat option on your website</a>.</p> \n<p>Chatbots are easy to program and many don't even require code. Artificial intelligence has made this functionality much more feasible for companies of all sizes. In fact, many companies offer live chat as a simple plugin for your CMS platform.</p> \n<p>Other reasons to consider a chatbot:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Case%2BStudy%2BWells%2BFargo%2BProves%2BThe%2BBusiness%2BCase%2BFor%2BOnline%2BChat/-/E-RES57154?objectid=RES57154\">44% of online consumers</a>&nbsp;say having questions answered by a live person while in the middle of an online purchase is one of the most important features a website can offer.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Case%2BStudy%2BWells%2BFargo%2BProves%2BThe%2BBusiness%2BCase%2BFor%2BOnline%2BChat/-/E-RES57154?objectid=RES57154\">63% said they are more likely to return</a>&nbsp;to a website if it offers live chat.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Case%2BStudy%2BWells%2BFargo%2BProves%2BThe%2BBusiness%2BCase%2BFor%2BOnline%2BChat/-/E-RES57154?objectid=RES57154\">38% said they made their purchase</a>&nbsp;due to the chat session itself, and <a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Case%2BStudy%2BWells%2BFargo%2BProves%2BThe%2BBusiness%2BCase%2BFor%2BOnline%2BChat/-/E-RES57154?objectid=RES57154\">62% reported</a>&nbsp;being more likely to purchase&nbsp;from the site again.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>8. 27% of people say it's most important to use original videos and images of your products or services on your website.</h3> \n<p>Customers like images —&nbsp;but they are weary of stock photos, particularly of products or services. This is where authentic behind-the-scenes videos and photos can help.</p> \n<p>For instance, if&nbsp;your company provides a service such as landscape design or IT maintenance, show before-and-after pictures of your work.</p> \n<p>If your service is something less tangible,&nbsp;such as insurance or life coaching, show&nbsp;pictures of your friendly staff and your belief system using visuals. Or, better yet, include video. Videos where you are explaining your business' purpose are powerful opportunities for increasing trust with potential customers.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>9. According to 10% of those polled, a newsletter sign-up button is a valuable component of a company's website.</h3> \n<p>Offering visitors to your site a chance to stay up-to-date via a subscription to your blog posts, newsletters, or product&nbsp;releases is a great way to stay top-of-mind for prospects and customers and increase brand loyalty.</p> \n<p>A subscription will let you share information about your company through email marketing, and build your email list at the same time. Use this list to share information you think your clients and prospects will find valuable whenever you have it.</p> \n<h3>Finally, Don't Forget About Analytics</h3> \n<p>Should you simply limit your web design to just these nine&nbsp;important design elements? Of course not. Depending on your industry&nbsp;and business needs,&nbsp;there are a number of other design integrations that should be considered a priority.</p> \n<p>And, of course, we can't&nbsp;forget the value of a&nbsp;compelling homepage, effective&nbsp;site navigation, mobile responsiveness, and more technical aspects like readability and accessibility.</p> \n<p>There's also one other critical element you should consider when designing your website: Analytics. Analytics can help you determine how your website is currently performing, the pages that attract the most visitors, and how you might improve and iterate on your web design for the long-haul.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, it's important to continue testing your web design over time to ensure it continues to meet — and exceed — consumers expectations.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=af934ebe-a3e6-4d2a-b12f-1c7ea40641fb&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Marketing Plan Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/af934ebe-a3e6-4d2a-b12f-1c7ea40641fb.png\"></a></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fblog%2Ftabid%2F6307%2Fbid%2F5521%2Fchart-of-the-week-what-buyers-want-from-your-website.aspx&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 19 Mar 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/aacfe6c7-71e6-4f49-979f-76099062afa0.png","linkMd5":"4e7b94a4c055d6c96f06fa4b220167a5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn3@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-30-681_5a38291bbbb54ba3.webp","destWidth":433,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5125,"destBytes":6842,"author":"Geoffrey Colon","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/aacfe6c7-71e6-4f49-979f-76099062afa0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn3@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-30-681_5a38291bbbb54ba3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Consumers%20Want%20to%20See%20on%20Company%20Websites,%20According%20to%20Marketers%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png?width=624&height=416&name=What%20Consumers%20Want%20to%20See%20on%20Company%20Websites,%20According%20to%20Marketers%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn83@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-59-731_21e977466d69ea46.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/af934ebe-a3e6-4d2a-b12f-1c7ea40641fb.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn3@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-54-880_b69ef96b2d492171.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fblog%2Ftabid%2F6307%2Fbid%2F5521%2Fchart-of-the-week-what-buyers-want-from-your-website.aspx&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn85@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-50-07-469_28eee9db56c55b27.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370115},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:29","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:29","title":"Do Blog Posts Actually Lead to Purchases [New Data]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/do-blog-posts-lead-to-purchases","description":"<p>In our <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/executive-marketing-leadership-survey?utm_source=hscm-exec-marketing-leadership-canva-122020-hpbnr&amp;_ga=2.198436399.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">2021 Executive Marketing Leadership Survey</a>, 20% of marketing leaders described company blogs as one of their \"most important channels\" for hitting goals.</p>  \n<p>The enduring importance placed on blogging isn't shocking. Not only can blogs <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/the-benefits-of-business-blogging-ht?_ga=2.198436399.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">boost your SEO, overall site traffic, and online presence</a>, but they can also help prospects learn more about your industry, brand, product, or service.</p> \n<p>But, starting and running an effective, traffic-generating blog requires a lot of time and energy. And, if you're a marketing manager on a tight budget, you might only be interested in tactics that directly benefit your bottom line.</p> \n<p>As you determine how you'll invest your time, effort, and money in 2021, you might ask yourself, \"Will my blog posts actually lead to purchases?\"</p> \n<p>To help marketers answer the question above, we surveyed nearly 300 consumers using Lucid software to learn if reading company blog posts had ever led them to make purchases from that brand.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=79c9c1d7-e329-46a2-9095-7ebf693a17f9&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download Now: How to Start a Successful Blog [Free Guide]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/79c9c1d7-e329-46a2-9095-7ebf693a17f9.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2>Do Blog Posts Lead to Purchases?</h2> \n<p>While the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing?_ga=2.198436399.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">growth of other content strategies</a>, like video marketing, might have you thinking that consumers will only buy products after seeing them on other platforms, you might be surprised by how consumers responded to our survey question.</p> \n<p>When we asked, \"Have you ever purchased something from a company after reading a blog post from them?\", a whopping 56% said, \"Yes.\"</p> \n<p><img alt=\"percentage of people who've bought something after reading a blog is 56%\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20Blog%20Posts%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png?width=624&amp;height=416&amp;name=Do%20Blog%20Posts%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\" height=\"416\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"http://luc.id\" style=\"font-size: 10px;\">Data Source</a></em></p> \n<p>While blogs are <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing?_ga=2.206679699.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">no longer the most commonly used type of marketing content</a>, data like the small survey above reaffirms that blogging is still an effective way to market your brand and even sell products.</p> \n<h2>Why Blogs Lead to Purchases</h2> \n<p>If your company has a blog that discusses your industry or how your offerings can help with the average reader's everyday pain points, your audiences can discover and gain trust in your brand's expertise. That trust and credibility could ultimately lead to purchases.</p> \n<p>Why? If a prospect trusts the advice or information given in your blog posts, they might trust that your offerings are better quality than your competitor's because your brand knows the industry, what customers want, and the pain points that your product or service solves.</p> \n<p>Even if you prefer video, social media, or visual marketing strategies, it's important to remember that blogs can help you sell products in ways that other content types can't.</p> \n<p>For instance, while videos and images might only give prospects a glimpse of how a product or service works in real life, blog posts can offer extensive information that a visual content editor might need to cut to avoid overwhelming a viewer on social media or other platforms.</p> \n<p>And, while blog posts offer more chances to provide in-depth information than some content types, they also could increase your search ranking and allow more opportunities to link directly to a landing or purchasing page. Because of this, consumers could find your content via search, read your post, and click straight to a product purchasing page with low friction after your content has persuaded them to buy a product.</p> \n<p>Additionally, because most blog sites allow you to embed videos, podcasts, and imagery, your company blog can also be a great place to promote your other marketing assets while still informing prospects about your brand. &nbsp;</p> \n<p>In the next year, consider a mix of content marketing that includes blogging. Not sure how to persuade shoppers with your blog posts? Here are a few quick tips.</p> \n<h2>How to Lead Readers to Purchases</h2> \n<h3>Strategically place product page links and CTAs.</h3> \n<p>Aside from mentioning your brand, product, or service where it feels natural in your blog posts, you can also use hyperlinks to link out to product pages, or <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/types-ctas-blog?_ga=2.170502816.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">CTA buttons that draw slightly more attention</a>&nbsp;to a product or offer without directing reader attention too far away from the blog post.</p> \n<p>At HubSpot, we usually place <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-anchor-text-call-to-action-study?_ga=2.170502816.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">at least three CTAs related to a blog topic in each post</a>: a text-based CTA in the introduction, a larger banner image at the bottom, and a slide-in CTA that shows up to the side of your text as you're scrolling through the middle of the post. This allows three mentions of a product or offering without interrupting the reader's experience.</p> \n<h3>Offer a free resource:</h3> \n<p>If your brand sells a subscription, service, or product that's on the pricier side or needs leadership approval from your company, blog readers might need more than a few blog posts to trust your brand and invest in your product. In that case, you might need to focus on lead-nurturing rather than sending blog readers directly to a purchasing page.</p> \n<p>HubSpot and many other blogs have grown their contact and qualified lead lists simply by creating a free downloadable resource, such as an ebook, template, or research report, and offering it through CTAs at the end of blog posts.</p> \n<p>Below is an example of a recent free research report resource we offered at the end of one of our Sales Blog posts:</p> \n<p><img alt=\"example of a blog post with a bottom CTA\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20Blog%20Posts%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Data%5D-1.png?width=578&amp;name=Do%20Blog%20Posts%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Data%5D-1.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; width: 578px; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"578\"></p> \n<p>To access free -- <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ungated-content-free?_ga=2.208259858.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">but gated</a>&nbsp;-- offers, readers must give basic information about themselves and their company. From there, they receive an automated email or instant download of the resource while also becoming a contact -- or lead -- and enter our lead-qualification process to see if they could be a good prospect to reach out to.</p> \n<p>The HubSpot Blog's free resource strategy results in <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-anchor-text-call-to-action-study?_ga=2.208259858.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">thousands of qualified leads</a>&nbsp;per year that could potentially convert into HubSpot customers. You can learn more about how to implement it on your blog <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-anchor-text-call-to-action-study\">here</a>.</p> \n<h3 style=\"color: #434343; font-size: 14px;\"><span style=\"color: #434343; font-size: 14px;\">Remember, quality beats over-promotion.</span></h3> \n<p>In another <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/why-do-people-read-blogs#:~:text=At%20the%20HubSpot%20Blog%2C%20each,teaches%20readers%20about%20something%20specific.&amp;text=We%20also%20like%20to%20include,ve%20just%20taught%20them%20about.\">recent Lucid survey</a>, one-third of our group of general consumer respondents most commonly read blog posts to \"learn something new.\" Meanwhile, roughly 20% read blog posts for the sake of entertainment.</p> \n<p>As a content creator, it's important to remember that readers will likely find your blog because they're looking for information related to an industry they work in, want to learn something related to their hobbies, or need solutions for a pain point they deal with in their daily or professional lives.</p> \n<p>Odds are, they're not looking solely for promotional content. If a reader visits your blog site and finds nothing but blog posts filled with product shots and cheesy advertorial language, they might lose interest in your content and might not develop the sense of trust needed to make a purchase.</p> \n<p>While it's wise to place a few unintrusive CTAs in your blog posts, and even mention your product or service when it feels relevant, be sure your content primarily offers valuable guidance, advice, and information that will help your reader and fulfill their needs.</p> \n<p>For example, in <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ai-social-media-tools?_ga=2.208259858.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">this post about AI social media tools</a>, we give valuable information about how to implement AI-based technology in a social media process while listing HubSpot as one of the tools readers can use. While we still mention our offerings, the post's goal is to show readers how multiple AI tools can streamline a marketing process.</p> \n<h2>Creating Your Blog Nurturing Process</h2> \n<p>Ultimately, every brand has a target audience with different interests and content needs. While one blog strategy, such as free resources, will work well to generate qualified leads for a B2B company, other tactics, like simply linking to a product in blog posts, might be more lucrative for consumer-facing brands.</p> \n<p>As you focus more on turning your blog traffic into revenue, keep these questions in mind:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>What information is valuable to my audience?</li> \n <li>Does my product require lead nurturing such gated offers?</li> \n <li>Will the tactic I'm using seem over-promotional or disengaging to my audience?</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Want to learn more about how the HubSpot blog generates leads? <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-anchor-text-call-to-action-study\">Check out this post</a>&nbsp;from one of our content acquisition managers. Or, take down <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-monetize-a-blog?_ga=2.128706316.1807057516.1616632512-1796057632.1616632512\">these tips on how to make money blogging</a>.</p> \n<p>Before you check out those pieces, be sure to download the free resource below.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=648420ad-1760-40e2-994f-7833315a7b7d&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\" \" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/648420ad-1760-40e2-994f-7833315a7b7d.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img
