\">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 25 Mar 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/79c9c1d7-e329-46a2-9095-7ebf693a17f9.png","linkMd5":"0a8f6e316d6c563a0c4178220962924c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn4@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-46-267_c7544506f7984ea7.webp","destWidth":537,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":6004,"destBytes":8470,"author":"pbump@hubspot.com (Pamela Bump)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/79c9c1d7-e329-46a2-9095-7ebf693a17f9.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn4@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-46-267_c7544506f7984ea7.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20Blog%20Posts%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png?width=624&height=416&name=Do%20Blog%20Posts%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn90@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-51-875_d2418f5644ae86cb.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Do%20Blog%20Posts%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Data%5D-1.png?width=578&name=Do%20Blog%20Posts%20Actually%20Lead%20to%20Purchases%20%5BNew%20Data%5D-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn2@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-53-099_a2e98d5956a66d7d.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/648420ad-1760-40e2-994f-7833315a7b7d.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn13@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-59-643_664a85cc59c4c0d8.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdo-blog-posts-lead-to-purchases&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn43@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-58-176_821c55a41e937488.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425369993},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"19 SEO Tips Straight From the Mouths of HubSpot's SEO Team","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/seo-tips","description":"<p>Back in 2017, HubSpot experienced something that had never happened before — <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/hubspot-blog-traffic-record-flat-year?_ga=2.23075065.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">our blog's monthly traffic flattened</a>. Even worse, it started to decline. So, after months of stressing over the mysterious cause of our blog's traffic plateau, we decided to sit down, chug a bunch of coffee, and find the culprit.</p> \n<p>We discovered that our editorial strategy of brainstorming topics and relying on our intuition to determine our audience's content preferences was no longer enough. We decided to pivot and focus our energies on the channel that has consistently generated most of our blog’s traffic for its entire existence — organic search.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Today, years after we adjusted our organic strategy, we've exceeded the majority of our monthly traffic goals and even broke some monthly traffic records. Needless to say, we're thrilled (and relieved) that our organic strategy fueled our traffic boost and shattered the great traffic plateau of 2017. In this post, we’ll outline the essential tips that helped us drive our organic strategy, with insight from HubSpot SEO experts.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=1d7211ac-7b1b-4405-b940-54b8acedb26e&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: SEO Starter Pack [Free Kit]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/1d7211ac-7b1b-4405-b940-54b8acedb26e.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<p><em>Download this checklist and save it to your desktop to check-off an SEO tip every time you complete it.</em></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/checklist.jpg?width=304&amp;name=checklist.jpg\" alt=\"downloadable seo checklist \" width=\"304\" style=\"width: 304px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<h3>1. Spend as much time on the SERPs as you do in tools.</h3> \n<p>Even though an algorithm dictates a search engine's results page (SERPs) rankings, the algorithm rewards web publishers that craft the best content on the internet.</p> \n<p>Because of this, it’s important to understand search intent. To accomplish this, we analyze a keyword's SERP and determine the problems users are trying to solve when searching for this query.</p> \n<p>Aja Frost, the Head of English SEO at HubSpot, says, \"Yes, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/seo-analysis-tools?_ga=2.23075065.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">tools</a> offer us a ton of information. But that information is often based on incomplete, out-of-date, or biased data sets. I encourage SEOs to combine the insights they're getting from their tools with real-time clues on the SERPs. Every time you decide to target a new keyword, refresh a piece of content, or diagnose a page or section of pages with irregular traffic, take a look at what's coming up for the main queries on Google.\"</p> \n<p>Depending on your goal, Frost says to pay attention to:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Search features,</li> \n <li>The type of content that's ranking (product pages, listicles, tutorials, etc.),</li> \n <li>The websites that are ranking (databases, businesses, media sites, directories, etc.),</li> \n <li>How far down the page the first organic result appears,</li> \n <li>How your page shows up (title, meta description, date, jump links, schema if applicable, etc.).</li> \n</ul> \n<p>When you conduct these kinds of searches, \"Don't forget to use an incognito window, frequently clear your cache, cookies, and history, and run your searches on both a desktop and phone,\" Frost adds.</p> \n<h3>2. Master the SERP overlap test.</h3> \n<p>While in SERPs, Frost conducts a SERP overlap test. She says, \"I use this test all the time to determine whether to target two-plus queries with a single piece of content.\"</p> \n<p>Now, you might be wondering, what is the SERP overlap test?</p> \n<p>Frost details the steps below:</p> \n<ol> \n <li>Do a quick search in incognito for Keyword A and a separate search for Keyword B.</li> \n <li>If the SERPs look fairly different (i.e., the top-ranking pages are different, or the first result for Keyword A is the ninth result for Keyword B), Google treats those queries as separate searches with different intent.&nbsp;</li> \n <li>However, if the SERPs have a lot of overlap, you can treat them as the same query.</li> \n</ol> \n<h3>3. Aim for the featured snippets in SERPs.</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-featured-snippet-box?_ga=2.23075065.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">Featured snippets</a> are what search engines use to display an answer to a query directly on the SERP, so a user doesn't need to visit another page to get the answer to their question. The image below is an example of a featured snippet for the query “What is inbound marketing?”</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-01%20at%203.46.59%20PM.jpg?width=600&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-01%20at%203.46.59%20PM.jpg\" alt=\"what is inbound marketing featured snippet box in google search results\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>As you can imagine, featured snippets <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-traffic-and-snippets?_ga=2.220205147.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">impact organic search results</a>, which is why it’s also essential to try and rank with as many featured snippets as possible.</p> \n<p>To do so, create posts that answer specific questions users have. The content within your featured snippet must be semantically relevant to the keyword a user searches for. This means that you can’t answer the question of “What is inbound marketing?” with unrelated content as the algorithm knows enough to detect relationships between the keywords and descriptions you give.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Additionally, your blog post should be organized and formatted in a way that lets Google know you've answered a question. For instance, this could mean using specific coding, so your featured snippet stands out on the page.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>According to Karla Cook, the Senior Manager of HubSpot's blog team, \"Targeting featured snippets with consistently formatted sections has removed some (but definitely not all) of the guesswork when it comes to ranking for featured snippets.\"</p> \n<p>\"Matthew Howells-Barby, Vice President of Marketing at HubSpot, has stressed that clean and consistent code is a significant factor in winning snippets.\"</p> \n<div>\n <iframe style=\"border: none; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\" src=\"https://listen.casted.us/player/6e702bcd\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\"></iframe>  \n</div> \n<h3>4. Consider on-page SEO, but not everything you publish has to be search-friendly.</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33655/a-step-by-step-guide-to-flawless-on-page-seo-free-template.aspx?_ga=2.220205147.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">On-page SEO</a> is the process of optimizing a page on your site with front and back-end components that help you rank higher in search engines. These components include:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>High-quality page content</li> \n <li>Page titles</li> \n <li>Headers</li> \n <li>Meta descriptions</li> \n <li>Image alt-text</li> \n <li>Structured markup</li> \n <li>Page URLs</li> \n <li>Internal linking</li> \n <li>Site speed</li> \n</ul> \n<p>For this example, let's focus on the copy-oriented elements like high-quality content, page titles, headers, meta descriptions, and image alt-text.</p> \n<p>You should prioritize creating optimized page copy to improve your SERP rankings. What you write should include your target keyword, be contextually relevant to your target keyword, and answer questions your users may have. Ultimately, the goal is to indicate to search engines that you've answered questions a user might have about a query.</p> \n<p>However, Victor Pan, Head of Technical SEO at HubSpot, says that not everything you publish has to be search-friendly.</p> \n<p>\"This could be ad landing pages, thank-you pages, internal sales enablement pages, and login pages. Prioritize optimizing for search when the opportunity is greater than the time invested, and leave the rest on the back burner. Tackle the back burner once you're able to build a process to reduce the amount of time needed to optimize,\" he adds.</p> \n<h3>5. Target a variety of high and low-volume keywords.</h3> \n<p>With an organic search strategy, it's important to target keywords that span an entire <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/what-is-the-buyers-journey?hsFormKey=0f3cd02747783fc65ebee06a2af3480d&amp;__hstc=259582869.c4a577029c49e44b73bd3bee6fa38565.1589932800150.1589932800151.1589932800152.1&amp;__hssc=259582869.1.1589932800153&amp;__hsfp=1235175601&amp;portalId=53&amp;_preview=true&amp;cacheBust=1594720451930&amp;preview_key=pSOAWoAu&amp;inpageEditorUI=true&amp;benderPackage=InpageEditorUI&amp;staticVersion=static-1.22392&amp;scriptPath=bundles%2Fapp.js&amp;cssPath=bundles%2Fapp.css&amp;hubs_signup-url=preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/content/5241498400&amp;hubs_signup-cta=null&amp;_ga=2.220205147.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">buyer's journey</a>, including a variety of high and low-volume keywords.</p> \n<p>Braden Becker, a Senior SEO Strategist at HubSpot, says, \"Broad, early-interest keywords tend to be higher in volume, while later-interest or even purchase-ready keywords tend to be lower in volume because the audience is more specific. Therefore, you shouldn't be afraid to target low-volume keywords if they have a higher likelihood of turning traffic into leads or customers.\"</p> \n<p>At HubSpot, the SEO team conducts in-depth keyword research for our four onsite blog properties (Marketing, Sales, Service, and Website). They first look for search volume, some as high as 120,000+ and some as low as 50 searches per month.</p> \n<p>According to Frost, it's important <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/organic-search-blog-strategy?_ga=2.220205147.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">to get creative</a> with the high-volume keywords you’re targeting.</p> \n<p>For example, when she was the editor on HubSpot's Sales blog, she assigned content that may have strayed from our usual topics but boasted significant search volume. However, all posts answered our audience’s questions, aligned with our values, and were well-researched and comprehensive.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>6. Consider pruning content after long periods of growth.</h3> \n<p>Pruning your content is the process of reducing the number of indexed pages by deleting old, low-quality content that doesn't add value to your site.</p> \n<p>Becker says, \"Consider 'pruning' content after long periods of growth. As websites grow and scale, you'll find some content fails to perform as expected. As that pile gets bigger, it can have adverse effects on the rest of your site's speed and performance. Audit your site for pages that aren't driving a certain level of traffic, backlinks, or conversions, and unpublish them.\"</p> \n<p>You can learn more about the content pruning process <a href=\"https://cognitiveseo.com/blog/5587/content-pruning-the-technique-that-will-protect-your-rankings-from-google-panda/\">here</a>.</p> \n<h3>7. Consolidate website pages using redirects and canonical tags.</h3> \n<p>When you conduct a site audit, you may find multiple pages containing similar content. If that happens, you should consider consolidating website pages using <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/7430/what-is-a-301-redirect-and-why-should-you-care.aspx?_ga=2.220205147.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">redirects</a> or <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/canonical-url?_ga=2.220205147.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">canonical tags</a>.</p> \n<p>Becker says, \"Nobody wants multiple pieces of website content serving the same purpose because it can cause you to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/keyword-cannibalization?_ga=2.220205147.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">cannibalize</a> your traffic in SERPs.\" To fix this, you can redirect low-performing pages to a page on your site containing related information.</p> \n<p>Becker adds, \"Besides redirecting, if you have exact duplicates, you may even add a canonical tag from the duplicate to the core page, which keeps the duplicate visible but tells Google to prioritize the core page when ranking your website. Be careful when deciding to canonicalize or redirect — these are delicate decisions and should only be made when it makes perfect sense to.\"</p> \n<p>Google explains more about this process <a href=\"https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/139066?hl=en\">here</a>.</p> \n<h3>8. Implement a historical optimization strategy.</h3> \n<p>In 2015, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/pamelump\">Pam Vaughn</a>, Principal Marketing Manager of HubSpot's Web Strategy and former Editor of HubSpot's Marketing Blog, made a revolutionary discovery about HubSpot's organic blog traffic — the overwhelming majority of it came from posts published before that month. In fact, 76% of our monthly blog views came from these old posts.</p> \n<p>Today, Vaughn's groundbreaking revelation rings louder than ever — 89% of our monthly blog views come from posts published at least six months prior, and we've developed an entire strategy dedicated to refreshing and republishing these historical pieces of content. We call these types of blog posts updates, and they comprise 35-40% of our editorial calendar.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>By refreshing them with new information, SEO tactics, and effectively republishing them as new blog posts, we can build upon their existing organic value and user engagement and double or even triple their traffic. This process also helps us optimize our blog for efficiency, decreasing the amount of new content we have to create while simultaneously increasing our organic traffic and conversions.</p> \n<p>Historical optimization isn't for everyone, though. It's a strategy catered for a blog that:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Generates a significant amount of organic traffic,</li> \n <li>Has a considerable amount of blog subscribers,</li> \n <li>Has social media followers that can supply a surge of traffic, shares, and backlinks to your updates,</li> \n <li>Owns a substantial repository of old posts that are worth refreshing and republishing.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>If you have all four of these things, we recommend implementing a historical optimization strategy. To learn about specific types of historical content you should update and the exact process of updating them, check out <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/historical-blog-seo-conversion-optimization?_ga=2.245104582.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">this blog post</a> written by Pam Vaughn herself.</p> \n<h3>9. Train your website visitors to search for your brand.</h3> \n<p>SEO is used to increase the number of unbranded searches for your business.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Pan says, \"The logic was that these were potential customers that would not have otherwise converted. This logic is good for a young business, but for mature businesses that have a good relationship with their customers, branded traffic is just as important.\"</p> \n<p>For example, platforms like Amazon have trained their customers searching on Google to append \"amazon\" to their searches for site-specific results.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Pan says you can encourage and inspire users to do this by becoming the go-to expert on topics related to your brand. Since Amazon is one of the leading shopping sites, customers refer to the platform for their shopping needs. To become an expert, you have to develop page authority.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>10. Develop page authority.</h3> \n<p>Page authority is <a href=\"https://backlinko.com/google-ranking-factors\">one of the factors</a> search engines use to determine rankings. For example, if you’re a seasoned blog with a reputation as a go-to industry expert, your site will likely rank higher than pages on a more recent site.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Given this, it’s important to build your brand and authority within your niche. Blogging regularly, posting on social media, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/guest-blogging?_ga=2.245104582.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">guest posting on other sites</a>, and simply being active in your industry are valuable ways to build your reputation.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Additionally, you should write about tangential topics your customers are interested in, helping you provide them with the most relevant information while also signaling to search engines that you write about your industry in-depth.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>All of these strategies will give your website authority and indicate to search engines that they need to pay attention to your domain.</p> \n<h3>11. Leverage the pillar-cluster model.</h3> \n<p>Since people heavily rely on Google to provide accurate and relevant answers to their questions, search engines need to understand every search’s intent and context.</p> \n<p>To do this, Google has evolved to recognize topical connections across user queries, monitor similar queries users have made in the past, and surface content that they deem the most authoritative on the topic. To help Google recognize our blog content as a trusted authority, we decided to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/pillar-cluster-model-transform-blog?_ga=2.245104582.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">implement the pillar-cluster model</a> (further explained in the video below).</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 200px; max-height: 113px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.5%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"200\" height=\"113\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/QJsQLwTeF60?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p>By creating a single pillar page that provides a high-level overview of a topic and hyperlinks to cluster pages, we effectively signaled to Google that our pillar page is a source of authority on the subject.</p> \n<p>Another benefit of the pillar-cluster model is that it provides site visitors with a better <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ux-user-experience?_ga=2.245104582.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">user experience</a>. Not only is it easier for Google to crawl our blog and identify semantic relationships between posts, but it's also easier for our audience to find the content they’re looking for.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>12. Create a link-building strategy.</h3> \n<p>Earning high-quality inbound links from websites and pages with high-authority is crucial for boosting your domain authority. Unfortunately, as nice as it would be, \"If you write it, they will link to it” is not a viable SEO tactic.</p> \n<p>The primary method we use to earn high-quality links is networking with other sites with a higher domain or page authority and requesting links to our content. We also make sure our content is relevant to the referring website's content. Another way to earn quality backlinks is by following Backlinko's <a href=\"https://backlinko.com/skyscraper-technique\">skyscraper method</a>.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>The skyscraper method involves identifying content that ranks well for keywords you want to rank for and creating content that is of better quality than the top-ranking posts. Then, you use SEO tools to find the sites that link to your competitor’s content and ask the most authoritative source to replace your competitor’s link with your links.</p> \n<p>Backlinko tried this strategy and asked 160 websites to link to their post about&nbsp;</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://backlinko.com/google-ranking-factors\">Google's 200 Ranking Factors</a>. As a result, they earned 17 backlinks from referring sites with high domain authority, and the posts’ organic traffic increased by 110% in only two weeks.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>13. Don’t change URLs.</h3> \n<p>The inventor of the internet, Tim Berners-Lee, once said, \"Cool URIs don't change.\"</p> \n<p>In fact, it's a <a href=\"https://www.w3.org/Provider/Style/URI.html\">popular saying</a> — \"What makes a cool URI? A cool URI is one which does not change. What sorts of URI change? URIs don't change: people change them.\"</p> \n<p>As a refresher, URI stands for <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/website/uri-vs-url?_ga=2.253260618.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">Uniform Resource Identifier</a> and it is meant to identify a resource, whereas a URL gives information about how to locate a resource. For example, a URI would be your name, and a URL would be your home address. Your name simply identifies you, and a address shares where to find you.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Pan says, \"URLs, a subset of URI's, should change as little as possible. The history of ‘why a URL changes' is filled with good intentions that often get lost with time, so be sure to add a note the same way you should when you notice traffic anomalies.\"</p> \n<p>Note: You can do this within HubSpot's constantly evolving <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/cos-general/how-to-redirect-a-hubspot-page?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/marketing/seo-tips&amp;hubs_post-cta=URL%20Mapping%20tool&amp;_ga=2.253260618.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">URL Mapping tool</a>.</p> \n<h3>14. Compress and optimize your multimedia files.</h3> \n<p>Compressing multimedia files may not seem like a high priority for your SEO strategy, but it should be. According to Becker, your video, image, and gif file size directly affect your site’s page load speed, which is one of the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/google-ranking-algorithm-infographic?_ga=2.253260618.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">ten most important</a> ranking factors.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>“The bigger an image's file size, the longer it takes your web browser to load that image, which increases your website's loading time as a whole. And the longer your website's loading time, the more likely it is that Google will penalize you,” he says.</p> \n<p>The act of compression blends similarly colored pixels into single pixels to reduce the image’s resolution and, in turn, file size. These changes are <a href=\"https://fireflydigital.com/image-compression/\">undetectable</a> to the human eye, as it is more sensitive to details between light and dark than colors. Compression does not diminish the impact your images will have on your audience, and your pages will load faster.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>High-quality tools for multimedia file compression are:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://squoosh.app/\">Squoosh</a>&nbsp;</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://tinypng.com/\">TinyPNG</a> (supports batch compression)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.youcompress.com/\">You Compress</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://clipchamp.com/en/video-compressor/\">Clipchamp</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>15. Use image alt text.</h3> \n<p>Search engine crawlers that scan your site can’t understand your images unless they include <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/image-alt-text?_ga=2.253260618.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">alt text</a> descriptions. Because of this, adding these descriptions to your pictures is a priority for SEO, as bots will strike against you if they can’t understand what’s on your site pages. Image alt text is also helpful for ranking your site pages in image-based SERPs.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Also, alt text is a best practice for creating an <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/website/web-accessibility?_ga=2.253260618.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">accessible website</a>. Screen readers can pick up on alt text when converting screen elements, ensuring that all of your site visitors have a consistent browsing experience.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>All alt-text should be descriptive, contextually relevant to the page content, and short. Consider the following example from Becker:&nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/david-ortiz-fenway-1.jpg?width=690&amp;name=david-ortiz-fenway-1.jpg\" alt=\"David Ortiz of the Boston Red Sox batting from home plate at Fenway Park\" width=\"690\" style=\"width: 690px;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.gq.com/story/boston-sports-guide\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Low-quality alt text would read “Baseball player hitting a ball at a baseball field,” while descriptive and contextual alt text would read \"David Ortiz of the Boston Red Sox batting from home plate at Fenway Park.\"&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>16. Leverage CTAs as often as possible.&nbsp;</h3> \n<p>Optimizing your page to rank in search engines doesn’t do you any good if your pages aren’t optimized to convert visitors. Aim to maximize conversion opportunities by using <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/calls-to-action?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fblog-anchor-text-call-to-action-study&amp;hubs_post-cta=utilizing%20a%20CTA%20tool&amp;_ga=2.48099556.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">calls-to-action</a> with content offers relevant to page content and the different stages of the buyer's journey.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>The image below is an example of a CTA on our <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blogging-for-seo?_ga=2.143990646.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">SEO Writing: 12 Tips on Writing Blog Posts That Rank on Google</a> blog post.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/cta-example.png?width=1374&amp;name=cta-example.png\" alt=\"example of seo starter pack cta in a hubspot blog post\" width=\"1374\" style=\"width: 1374px;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blogging-for-seo\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Every page on your site is an opportunity for conversion, so every page on your site should include a CTA that aligns with visitor search intent. Since you can assume that page visitors are there to learn something, CTAs are exciting as they offer more insight and educational information.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>17. Form good relationships with your developers and designers.</h3> \n<p>Hitting your SEO goals isn’t a marketing-specific effort — you’ll also need to collaborate with our developers and designers. Because of this, Frost suggests forming good relationships with these teams.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>She says, \"Get to know these people, learn their language, figure out what motivates them (usually it's cool projects), and, most importantly, teach them important SEO concepts. This could entice them to come to you before deleting an older page that has 500 backlinks.\"</p> \n<h3>18. Conduct a technical SEO audit.</h3> \n<p>When a search engine bot crawls your site for indexing, it needs to understand what your site is. That refers to content but also how your site is set up. Unorganized websites are difficult to index because contextual relationships are hard to discern, and, as a result, these pages won’t rank in SERPs.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Because of this, your site’s <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/technical-seo-guide?_ga=2.224342872.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">technical set-up</a> is a critical component of SEO. These technical aspects can include, but are not limited to:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Page speed</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/build-sitemap-website?_ga=2.224342872.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">XML site map</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/parts-url?_ga=2.224342872.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">URL structure</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/website-architecture?_ga=2.224342872.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">Site architecture</a></li> \n <li>Pagination</li> \n</ul> \n<p>To avoid strikes from bots, we recommend conducting a technical audit of your web pages.</p> \n<h3>19. Check, double-check, and triple-check your data.</h3> \n<p>To truly succeed in your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/seo?_ga=2.224342872.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">SEO strategy</a>, you need to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/seo-analysis-tools?_ga=2.224342872.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">measure your success</a> by checking standard data metrics like organic traffic growth, conversion rate, bounce rate, and keyword rankings.</p> \n<p>Becker says, \"Growing organic traffic takes time, but it also takes a village. When performing keyword research, traffic analysis, or any performance-related audit, always have more than one source of data to guide you.”&nbsp;</p> \n<p>If you see traffic drop in your <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/cms?hubs_post=blog.hubspot.com/marketing/seo-tips&amp;hubs_post-cta=content%20management%20system&amp;_ga=2.224342872.277259835.1614954717-557398049.1614954717\">content management system</a>, check Google Search Console to see which pages that drop has affected. If the decline is concentrated to just a few pages or articles, use a rankings tracker to determine if you've lost position for any high-volume keywords. The smarter your diagnostics are, the better your decisions are in response.</p> \n<h2>SEO Is An Ever-Evolving Landscape</h2> \n<p>This post uncovered tactics that helped us devise an SEO strategy that allowed us to shatter a year-long traffic plateau and break monthly traffic records. However, as SEO is continuously changing, it’s entirely possible that these practices could become obsolete one day.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>The moral of our blog's story isn't to glom onto these SEO tactics for the rest of your content marketing career; it's to keep adapting, no matter how well you're performing.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in March 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=8835eaa3-be7b-4697-81d2-488e03708d34&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"SEO Starter Pack\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8835eaa3-be7b-4697-81d2-488e03708d34.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 29 Mar 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/1d7211ac-7b1b-4405-b940-54b8acedb26e.png","linkMd5":"9223624e712c407699c519a21fe0e6da","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn87@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-30-734_ac504860637ee534.webp","destWidth":368,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":4411,"destBytes":6042,"author":"Rebecca Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/1d7211ac-7b1b-4405-b940-54b8acedb26e.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn87@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-30-734_ac504860637ee534.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/checklist.jpg?width=304&name=checklist.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn7@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-54-711_e1f26ab56a087abe.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-01%20at%203.46.59%20PM.jpg?width=600&name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-01%20at%203.46.59%20PM.jpg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/david-ortiz-fenway-1.jpg?width=690&name=david-ortiz-fenway-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn94@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-50-00-142_6ba68c13fbea4bf2.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/cta-example.png?width=1374&name=cta-example.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn45@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-59-684_521e88126adb91e9.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8835eaa3-be7b-4697-81d2-488e03708d34.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn18@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-51-552_be9ebc9bbdc9c6d5.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fseo-tips&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn64@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-54-199_cd7de1413a7e8ce0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370011},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"The 10 Best Video Conferencing Tools for Small Businesses","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/video-conferencing-small-business","description":"<p>Over the past year, marketers got a crash course in remote work.</p> \n<p>As 2021 approached, many of us had already invested in at-home desks, workout equipment, and other tools meant to make work-from-home a little easier.</p> \n<p>At the top of that list? Video conferencing software.</p> \n<p>Video conferencing tools saw a <a href=\"https://www.trustradius.com/vendor-blog/covid-19-software-industry-data-and-statistics\">500% increase in demand in 2020</a>&nbsp;as a result of the worldwide pandemic. And, as the workforce continues to shift to a more <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/post-covid-workplaces\">flexible, hybrid model</a>, it's critical your business invests in equipment designed to foster collaboration regardless of an employee's location.</p> \n<p>But video conferencing software isn't always cheap, and the fancy bells-and-whistles aren't always necessary for small businesses looking for a simple, effective solution.</p> \n<p>Here, we've compiled 10 of the best video conferencing tools for small businesses, ranging in price and features, to help you find the best fit for your needs.</p> \n<p>But first — what are the benefits of video conferencing software, and do you need it, anyway?</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=52250291-8fed-4fe7-ad28-e6e244e1fcd8&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download our complete productivity guide here for more tips on improving your  productivity at work.\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/52250291-8fed-4fe7-ad28-e6e244e1fcd8.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2>Video Conferencing Benefits</h2> \n<p>Video conferencing offers opportunities for collaboration, productivity, and increased engagement with colleagues, stakeholders, and customers — all without the hassle (and cost) of traveling to an in-person location.</p> \n<p>I could write a whole blog post about the benefits of video conferencing, but for our purposes, let's focus on four:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Video conferencing is a cost-effective opportunity to have face-to-face interactions with colleagues, prospects, stakeholders, or customers. It's more personal and engaging than a phone call, and it's much cheaper and more efficient than paying to commute — or fly — to a physical location to meet someone for an in-person conversation.</li> \n <li>Like mentioned above, video conferencing offers an opportunity for more personal connection. Eye contact, facial expressions, and body language are cues we use to effectively communicate with one another on a daily basis — and those cues are all lost in a phone or email conversation. &nbsp;</li> \n <li>Video conferencing can increase your team's productivity, since it limits the amount of time you spend running to conference rooms in-between meetings, driving to meet a client, etc.</li> \n <li>Video conferencing can foster increased collaboration, as opposed to email or Slack. For instance, if I hear an interesting project a colleague is working on, I'll ask them to join a quick Zoom call with me so we can discuss opportunities for collaboration — which is much more efficient than emailing about it.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>However, video conferencing software can be expensive, and if you work for a small business with limited resources, it can be difficult to persuade leadership that it's a worthwhile investment. Fortunately, you don't have to break the bank to test it out — in fact, a few of the tools in this list are free forever, and others offer free trials.</p> \n<p>Let's dive into the most impressive video conferencing tools we've found for small businesses.</p> \n<h2>10 Best Video Conferencing Tools for Small Businesses</h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://explore.zoom.us/meetings\">Zoom</a>&nbsp;</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/zoom-Mar-02-2021-08-10-27-46-PM.png?width=1204&amp;name=zoom-Mar-02-2021-08-10-27-46-PM.png\" alt=\"zoom dashboard example\" width=\"1204\" style=\"width: 1204px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pros:</strong> If you're on a tight budget, you can't beat the free option you get with Zoom, one of the <a href=\"https://www.g2.com/categories/video-conferencing/small-business\">highest-rated video conferencing</a>&nbsp;tools available. The tool offers clear audio with background noise suppression, an option to share your screen, and a recording function to save and send the meeting to those unable to participate.</p> \n<p>Additionally, Zoom has a few fun, engaging tools for increased participation among attendees — including filters, reactions, polls, hand raising, and chat. Plus, you can schedule a Zoom meeting right from your Outlook, Gmail, or iCal email calendar.</p> \n<p>Zoom is also part of the <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/webinar/zoom\">HubSpot ecosystem</a>&nbsp;and connects seamlessly with your CRM.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons:</strong> Outside of meetings, Zoom doesn't offer any collaboration tools such as file sharing or messaging to follow-up with colleagues — additionally, the links you might've shared in the Zoom chat aren't saved anywhere for later viewing. You also can't add a meeting agenda to the invite from the app itself.</p> \n<p>Overall, Zoom is a great option for small teams, but as you scale, there are some growing pains. For instance, you can get 100 participants in a meeting for 40 minutes with the free version, but if you have a company of 100+, you'll need to pay more to increase participants.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong>Free for Basic, which includes the ability to host up to 100 participants, up to 40 minutes of group meeting time, and unlimited one-on-one meetings. $149.90 per year for Pro version, which is recommended for small teams, and $199.90 per year for Small &amp; Med Businesses version.</p> \n<h3>2. <strong><a href=\"https://www.jiminny.com/\">Jiminny</a>&nbsp;</strong></h3> \n<p><strong><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/jiminny.png?width=840&amp;name=jiminny.png\" alt=\"jiminny dashboard example\" width=\"840\" style=\"width: 840px;\"></strong></p> \n<p><strong>Pros: </strong>Jiminny offers a ton of unique, impressive features that can be particularly useful if you're hoping to use your video conferencing tool for your sales team or for client-facing purposes.</p> \n<p>For instance, the software offers a \"Themes\" feature, which means your meeting recording will be automatically broken up into important parts like \"Next Steps\" — for anyone who's ever scanned an hour-long meeting recording looking for a two-minute conversation right in the middle, this can greatly increase efficiency with follow-up materials.</p> \n<p>The recording feature can integrate with your CRM to automatically input data from your recordings, enabling you to reduce the time-consuming task of manual note-taking. The software also offers metrics such as ratio of talking versus listening to improve your sales reps conversation (and listening) skills.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong>The company is in the early-stages, so as they continue to iterate and improve on their product, you might experience some growing pains. Additionally, if you're <em>not </em>planning on using the video conferencing tool for prospect/customer-facing purposes, some of these features might be unnecessary for your internal marketing team.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong>Pro plans starting at $75/month per user if you sign up for a full year; that goes up to $95/month per user if billed monthly.</p> \n<h3>3. <strong><a href=\"https://apps.google.com/intl/en/meet/\">Google Meet</a></strong></h3> \n<p><strong><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/google%20meet.png?width=1130&amp;name=google%20meet.png\" alt=\"google meet's dashboard\" width=\"1130\" style=\"width: 1130px;\"></strong></p> \n<p><strong>Pros: </strong>Google Meet is an incredibly cheap and easy-to-use video conferencing tool for small teams. In fact, if you're not interested in recording or storing meetings, the tool is free forever for up to 100 participants.</p> \n<p>Google Meet integrates with other apps and even lets you build a custom app using Apps Script. The tool also comes with unlimited Google Drive storage.</p> \n<p>Additionally, the tool offers a speech-to-text real-time captioning feature for video chats and meetings — ideal for hearing impaired participants, non-native speakers, or participants with noisy backgrounds.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong>The free version doesn't offer the ability to record or save your meetings, which means you'll need to upgrade if you need either feature.</p> \n<p>Google doesn't offer personalized setup or training, and it doesn't offer the same robust features as some of the other options in this list. It also can't support more than 250 participants, so it won't work if you plan on hosting larger webinars or conferences.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong>The app is free for up to 100 participants and an unlimited number of meetings. However, if you want to record or store meetings, pricing starts at $8/month per user.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.bluejeans.com/products\">Bluejeans</a>&nbsp;</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/hey-4.png?width=1480&amp;name=hey-4.png\" alt=\"Bluejeans virtual conference dashboard\" width=\"1480\" style=\"width: 1480px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pros: </strong>Bluejeans, a video conferencing software created by Verizon, offers impressive features such as the ability to use AI and voice recognition to automatically take notes, create action items, and identify key moments for later follow-up. Additionally, engagement is a breeze from within the tool with features such as screen sharing, polling, Q&amp;A, and chat.</p> \n<p>Bluejeans integrates with messaging, scheduling, and productivity tools, and offers impressive security and scalability requirements.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong>Bluejeans doesn't offer file sharing capabilities, and if you only purchase the Me plan, you're limited to 25 hours of recordings. Additionally, support is limited.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong>$13.99/host per month, up to 75 participants and 25 hours of recordings.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://www.gotomeeting.com/\">GoToMeeting</a>&nbsp;</h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/logmein.png?width=952&amp;name=logmein.png\" alt=\"GotoMeeting's example dashboard\" width=\"952\" style=\"width: 952px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pros: </strong>LogMeIn's video conferencing software has some impressive features, including a \"Smart Meeting Assistant\" transcription service that automatically transcribes the meeting so you can search through and share detailed notes with others.</p> \n<p>You can record the meeting and store the recording locally or in the cloud, and participants can join the meeting on desktop or through a mobile app.</p> \n<p>Overall, GotoMeeting's HD video and audio software is high-quality and integrates easily with Google Calendar or Chrome for increased efficiency.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong>GoToMeeting requires an error-fee data connection to work well, and some reviewers have noted the <a href=\"https://www.getapp.com/it-communications-software/a/gotomeeting/features/\">mobile app isn't as user-friendly as they'd like</a>. Additionally, the Professional plan doesn't offer the transcription, note taking, or drawing features.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong>$16/user per month, for up to 250 participants, for Business plan.</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://www.skype.com/en/features/group-video-chat/\">Skype</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/skype-1.png?width=1086&amp;name=skype-1.png\" alt=\"Skype for Business video call\" width=\"1086\" style=\"width: 1086px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pros: </strong>If you have a tight budget and you're often calling people from across the globe, Skype could be a great option for you. The software is free to use, and doesn't charge users for calling anyone from <em>anywhere</em> in the world. Video calls can also include up to 50 participants at once. The tool is easy to install and use.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong>The audio quality isn't always great with Skype, particularly since Skype's audio quality is based on bandwidth, so if users have a slow speed ISP, then audio quality will be negatively affected. Additionally, since Skype calls occur over the internet, there's always a possibility that data will be intercepted. This makes it a less secure option than some others in the list.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong><span style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Free</span></p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/group-chat-software/\">Microsoft Teams</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/microsoft-Mar-02-2021-08-05-46-32-PM.png?width=1338&amp;name=microsoft-Mar-02-2021-08-05-46-32-PM.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Team dashboard\" width=\"1338\" style=\"width: 1338px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pros:</strong> If you're planning on hosting large webinars or conferences with over 250+ attendees, Microsoft Teams is a good tool for you to consider. The software allows up to 10,000 participants to meet at once, and lets you host with anyone inside or outside your organization.</p> \n<p>Additionally, Microsoft Teams enables you to organize different departments or groups into \"Teams\" (which can be up to a few thousand people) — within those Teams, you can have separate channels of conversations and focus on different projects.</p> \n<p>Microsoft Teams provides a few impressive features for increased engagement, including notifications, mentions, comments, GIFs and emojis in chats, and the ability to chat one-on-one or in groups. The software also offers advanced security features.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong>Microsoft Teams is an inclusive option for ensuring everyone within a given \"Team\" automatically has access to all the files, notes, and channels in the Team. Unfortunately, that means you don't have permission settings to inhibit certain users from accessing files within a group, and you also can't invite guest users to selected channels.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong>Microsoft 365 Business Basic is $5/user per month (annual commitment) and allows for 300 participants, but doesn't include the advanced security and compliance features, administration, or support. Microsoft 365 Business Standard is $12.50/user per month (annual commitment), and Office 365 E3 is $20/user per month (annual commitment) and includes everything Microsoft Teams has to offer.</p> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://www.ringcentral.com/\">RingCentral Video</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/hey-Mar-02-2021-08-28-56-36-PM.png?width=968&amp;name=hey-Mar-02-2021-08-28-56-36-PM.png\" alt=\"RingCentral's video dashboard on desktop and phone\" width=\"968\" style=\"width: 968px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pros: </strong>RingCentral offers HD video and high-quality audio, and it's a cost-effective option for an unlimited number of users, video meetings with up to 100 participants, and up to 24-hour meeting duration. The software enables you to hop easily between mobile and desktop devices, and provides seven layers of security.</p> \n<p>Additionally, RingCentral provides personalized onboarding training and 24/7 live support, so if you feel your team might need support getting set up or in the future, this is a good option to consider.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong>RingCentral offers a recording feature but it's only available as an offline option, meaning you need to download the recording as a local hard disk rather than a publicly available folder like Dropbox. The software also doesn't come with its own calendar and task management function to integrate video meetings with your calendar events — for that, you'll need to download the company's Glip app.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong>$24.99/user per month for the standard version.</p> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://www.zoho.com/meeting/\">Zoho Meeting</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/zoho-2.png?width=1660&amp;name=zoho-2.png\" alt=\"Zoho meeting attendee list dashboard\" width=\"1660\" style=\"width: 1660px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pros: </strong>One of the most cost-effective options in the list, this is a good, user-friendly video conferencing software for small businesses. Users don't need to download and install any software, since Zoho is hosted on a web browser, and the software offers all the basic features you'd need in a video conferencing tool, including screen sharing and meeting recordings.</p> \n<p>Aditionally, you can use 100+ local dial-in numbers and 55+ toll-free numbers to join from different countries. Best of all, the interface is easy to navigate and use.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong>Zoho Meeting limits attendees to 100. If you need more participants than that, you'll need to switch to Zoho Webinar. You also need to purchase an add-on if you plan on storing over 10 recordings.</p> \n<p>The tool doesn't offer some of the fancy features we've seen elsewhere in this list, including a smart assistant or cloud video recording. Still, this is a good option for smaller teams who don't need all the bells and whistles.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong>$2.50/host per month for 10 participants, $5/host per month for 25 participants, and $10/host per month for 100 participants.</p> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"https://www.intermedia.com/anymeeting-video-conferencing\">Intermedia AnyMeeting</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/intermedia.png?width=1508&amp;name=intermedia.png\" alt=\"intermedia anymeeting dashboard screenshare\" width=\"1508\" style=\"width: 1508px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pros:</strong> Intermedia AnyMeeting has a clean, easy-to-use interface and offers an impressive array of features — including an AI-powered smart assistant for meeting transcriptions, and screen annotations so participants can direct attention to key points on a shared screen — for a relatively low cost.</p> \n<p>The software integrates with plenty of popular office tools including Outlook, G-Suite, and Slack, and offers unlimited recording storage and sharing capabilities. With the Pro version, you're also able to create custom branded meetings with a company logo and personalized background.</p> \n<p><strong>Cons: </strong>Intermedia AnyMeeting doesn't have end-to-end encryption of ongoing calls, which could raise privacy and security concerns. Additionally, some <a href=\"https://www.g2.com/products/anymeeting-video-conferencing/reviews#reviews\">G2 reviewers have mentioned the audio</a>&nbsp;quality could be better.</p> \n<p><strong>Price: </strong>$9.99/user per month for the Lite version, which enables up to 10 participants. $12.99/user per month for the Pro version, which enables up to 100 participants.</p> \n<p>Remember — when choosing video conferencing software, it's critical you keep your own team's needs, resources, and requirements in-mind. If you're still unsure after reading through this list, consider testing out a few demos or trial versions to see which feels best-suited for your brand.&nbsp;</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=3d8890a4-b446-496e-b60f-a8a7ee44ae85&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-Action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3d8890a4-b446-496e-b60f-a8a7ee44ae85.png\"></a></p>  \n<img Forsey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/52250291-8fed-4fe7-ad28-e6e244e1fcd8.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-30-665_e57995fecd8b2257.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/zoom-Mar-02-2021-08-10-27-46-PM.png?width=1204&name=zoom-Mar-02-2021-08-10-27-46-PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn38@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-50-00-005_c9f4bb8ec2b0854c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/jiminny.png?width=840&name=jiminny.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn51@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-54-196_27dba2b8a371a9bc.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/google%20meet.png?width=1130&name=google%20meet.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn83@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-56-675_34251738e33c280d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/hey-4.png?width=1480&name=hey-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn18@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-50-02-058_a0adc5c5d7b29fc3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/logmein.png?width=952&name=logmein.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn13@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-59-662_9af514841e8bc0e4.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/skype-1.png?width=1086&name=skype-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn16@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-50-01-322_43d7c2434c466865.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/microsoft-Mar-02-2021-08-05-46-32-PM.png?width=1338&name=microsoft-Mar-02-2021-08-05-46-32-PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn81@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-50-01-971_145b0836ad4f3b8d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/hey-Mar-02-2021-08-28-56-36-PM.png?width=968&name=hey-Mar-02-2021-08-28-56-36-PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn37@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-51-620_2940ab5b8e35cff5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/zoho-2.png?width=1660&name=zoho-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn50@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-59-168_c3bef37e7f20c6ba.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/intermedia.png?width=1508&name=intermedia.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn9@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-52-401_9e13608eaea80b78.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3d8890a4-b446-496e-b60f-a8a7ee44ae85.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn69@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-50-01-981_d4985b3af97d5b9c.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fvideo-conferencing-small-business&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn99@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-50-00-061_7313ff8e2c9b6876.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370130},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"How to Make Quotes for Instagram: 9 Apps to Try This Year","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/quote-maker-apps-instagram","description":"<p>When you come across a beautiful sight -- be it a beach, a mountain, or your pet's face -- sometimes, it inspires you to think bigger about what certain sights and experiences mean.</p>  \n<p>For those moments, you might consider posting a photo on Instagram with an equally inspiring quote as the caption. But you could take it even further -- and save characters -- by posting the photo <em>with </em>the quote.<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=890d1040-16c9-4b04-a1be-fe38f6c25c8f&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Access Now: 9 Free Instagram Quote Templates\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/890d1040-16c9-4b04-a1be-fe38f6c25c8f.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>You've likely seen quotes on Instagram posts before, but you may never have created one for your brand's account. Here's a recent Instagram quote we shared here at HubSpot:</p> \n<iframe class=\"instagram-media instagram-media-rendered\" style=\"background: white; max-width: 658px; width: calc(100% - 2px); border-radius: 3px; border: 1px solid #dbdbdb; box-shadow: none; display: block; margin: 0px 0px 12px; min-width: 326px; padding: 0px;\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/Bfd2PKED_MH/embed/captioned/?cr=1&amp;v=8&amp;wp=1192&amp;rd=https%3A%2F%2Fpreview.hs-sites.com&amp;rp=%2F_hcms%2Fpreview%2Fcontent%2F5051275376%3F_preview%3Dtrue%26benderPackage%3DInpageEditorUI%26cacheBust%3D1612817050612%26cssPath%3Dbundles%252Fapp.css%26inpageEditorUI%3Dtrue%26localAssets%3Dfalse%26portalId%3D53%26preview_key%3DLpOWCOli%26sc#%7B%22ci%22%3A1%2C%22os%22%3A13191.879999998491%2C%22ls%22%3A1680.3799999906914%2C%22le%22%3A1683.4499999968102%7D\" height=\"1068\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>   \n<p>See what we mean?</p> \n<p>Posting quote images on Instagram can diversify your content on the platform and humanize your brand a little, too. Everyone could use a motivational quote during a busy Monday morning or a slow Tuesday afternoon, so try out an Instagram quote for your next post with the help of these free apps.</p> \n<div> \n <p class=\"p1\"></p> \n</div> \n<h2>9 Instagram Text Apps to Make Inspiring Quotes</h2> \n<h3>Featured Resource: <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/instagram-templates-for-business?hubs_post-cta=header\">9 Instagram Quote Templates</a></h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/instagram-templates-for-business?hubs_post-cta=image\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-02-08%20at%203.16.19%20PM-1.png?width=404&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-02-08%20at%203.16.19%20PM-1.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2021-02-08 at 3.16.19 PM-1\" width=\"404\" style=\"width: 404px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></a>HubSpot created a collection of 9 Instagram quote templates for posts and stories – in addition to 13 more free Instagram posts for business. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/instagram-templates-for-business?hubs_post-cta=imagebottom\">Download the collection of templates</a> today to make Instagram quotes right in Google Slides for free.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>1. FaceGarage</h3> \n<h4><a href=\"http://www.facegarage.com/photoEditors/instagramQuotes\">Web App</a></h4> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/FaceGarage-Step%206.jpg?width=320&amp;name=FaceGarage-Step%206.jpg\" alt=\"Image from FaceGarage, an Instagram text and quote maker app\" width=\"320\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 320px;\"></p> \n<p><a href=\"http://www.facegarage.com/\">FaceGarage</a> is a browser tool that helps you create Instagram images with quotes overlaid in just a few simple steps. You can upload an image of your own or use one of the site's stock background images, type in your quote, adjust the font, text size, color, and formatting, and voila -- you generate your image and download it to post on Instagram.</p> \n<p>Our favorite thing about FaceGarage is the images don't come with a watermark, so you can create more beautiful posts that don't have a logo in the corner.</p> \n<h3>2. Canva</h3> \n<h4><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/canva-photo-editor-design/id897446215?mt=8\">iOS</a>, <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.canva.editor&amp;hl=en_US\">Android</a>, or <a href=\"https://about.canva.com/\">Web App</a></h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/canva%20instagram%20quote%20maker%20app.png\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Image from Canva, an Instagram text and quote maker app\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span style=\"font-size: 13px;\">Image via <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.canva.editor&amp;hl=en_US\">Google Play</a></span></p> \n<p>Canva's many features extend beyond text-based pictures and, for that matter, social media. But the mobile app and its gorgeous pre-made templates make it perfect for Instagram quotes.</p> \n<p>Using the Canva's social media post setting, you can draft banners, flyers, cards, and posts of all shapes and sizes using one of hundreds of pro-level backgrounds. Of course, feel free to snap a photo on the go, as well. One you select your image, you can choose from more than 100 fonts, adjust the size and color, and publish.</p> \n<h3>3. ReciteThis</h3> \n<h4><a href=\"http://recite.com/\">Web App</a></h4> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/recite-example.png?width=320&amp;name=recite-example.png\" alt=\"Image from ReciteThis, an Instagram text and quote maker app\" width=\"320\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 320px;\"></p> \n<p><a href=\"http://recitethis.com/\">ReciteThis</a> is another quick and easy browser tool you can use to create quotes for Instagram. Its two-step process involves selecting one of the ready-made background themes, typing in your quotation, and pressing \"Create.\" From there, you can upload the image to a variety of social networks (not including Instagram) or download the image to upload and post on Instagram.</p> \n<p>The downside to ReciteThis's ease of use is the highly visible watermark in the bottom-center of each image, but you might be able to crop it out using your phone's photo editor before uploading to Instagram, depending on the design you choose.</p> \n<h3>4. Word Swag</h3> \n<h4><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/word-swag-cool-typography/id645746786?mt=8&amp;ign-mpt=uo%3D4\">iOS</a> or <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=co.wordswag.wordswag&amp;hl=en_US\">Android</a></h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BiwrvYUFVcl/?taken-by=wordswag\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/word-swag-quote-maker-app.png\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Image from Word Swag, an Instagram text and quote maker app\"></a></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span style=\"font-size: 13px;\">Image via <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BiwrvYUFVcl/?taken-by=wordswag\">Word Swag</a></span></p>  \n<p>Listed in iTunes's top 100 apps in the&nbsp;<em>Photo &amp; Video</em> category, Word Swag helps you create text images that are as edgy as the app's name sounds. The app uses a special typing engine to create fresh quote designs based on the background picture you're working with.</p> \n<p>Just select (or shoot) your picture, type your quote into the app's plain text editor, select one of nearly 50 styles, and shuffle through the diverse choices that appear. Word Swag has literally thousands of quote and image options to choose from through a handy integration from Pixabay, a free image gallery.</p> \n<h3>5. InstaQuote</h3> \n<h4><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/instaquote-add-text-captions/id551012097\">iOS</a> or <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.redcactus.instaquote&amp;hl=en\">Android</a></h4> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/InstaQuote.jpg?width=320&amp;name=InstaQuote.jpg\" alt=\"Image from InstaQuote, an Instagram text and quote maker app\" width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>This free app offers a lot of options to customize your quote image, font styles, and color schemes. You can use your own photos or one of InstaQuote's, and it allows you to automatically upload your image to Instagram so you don't have to download it and <em>then</em> upload it.</p> \n<p>The downsides to many free apps -- including InstaQuote -- are the prevalence of ad interruptions, and that many features are locked unless you upgrade to the paid version.</p> \n<h3>6. Text2Pic</h3> \n<h4><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/text2pic-musical-text-on-photo/id536817268\">iOS</a> or <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=textpic.wonder.caption&amp;hl=en\">Android</a></h4> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Text2Pic.png?width=320&amp;name=Text2Pic.png\" alt=\"Image from Text2Pic, an Instagram text and quote maker app\" width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>Text2Pic stands out from the crowd in a couple of ways. It has the widest variety of font style and formatting options -- including 3-D and shadowing capabilities to add more effects to your text. It also auto-connects to Instagram for seamless uploading and posting on the platform.</p> \n<p>The biggest downside we've noted is the inability to upload your own photo as a background image, but Text2Pic makes up for that with a ton of different background options to choose from.</p> \n<h3>7. Quotes Creator</h3> \n<h4><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/quotes-creator/id895331100?mt=8\">iOS</a> or <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.ist.quotescreator&amp;hl=en\">Android</a></h4> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/quotes%20creator.jpg?width=320&amp;name=quotes%20creator.jpg\" alt=\"Image from Quotes Creator, an Instagram text and quote maker app\" width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>Quotes Creator has a neat feature that suggests quotes to use -- including their attributions -- to take the work out of creating an inspirational post for you. We also like how subtly transparent the watermark is to make it as distraction-free as possible. This is another easy-to-use app that creates quotes for Instagram in just a few simple steps -- with an easy tap to upload to the platform.</p> \n<p>Quotes Creator's stock background options are a little cheesy, so we recommend finding your own and uploading them.</p> \n<h3>8. Quote Maker</h3> \n<h4><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/quote-maker/id1084636376?mt=8\">iOS</a> or <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.psd2filters.quotemaker&amp;hl=en\">Android</a></h4> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Quotes%20Maker-1.jpg?width=320&amp;name=Quotes%20Maker-1.jpg\" alt=\"Image from Quote Maker, an Instagram text app\" width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>Quote Maker is another free app that tries to upsell its Pro version to unlock more background and style options, but you can always upload your own background if you feel too limited. Where Quotes Maker takes the cake is its cool font styling and effects. You could add neat decals to your brand's name or a stamp-like effect to a company motto or mission statement.</p> \n<p>We recommend exploring the app, but another warning -- it can be glitchy if your design and editing actions get more complex. It's best for simple images, like the one above.</p> \n<h3>9. Text on Photo Square</h3> \n<h4><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/text-on-photo-square-add-beautiful-captions-fonts-to/id767873908?mt=8\">iOS</a> only</h4> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Text%20on%20Photo%20Square.jpg?width=320&amp;height=320&amp;name=Text%20on%20Photo%20Square.jpg\" alt=\"Image from Text on Photo Square, an Instagram quote maker app\" width=\"320\" height=\"320\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>Text on Photo Square is only available on iOS devices (for now), but its distinction from the rest of the pack is that users can add quotes to videos, in addition to photos. You can upload your videos and add quotes to create a neat audio and visual experience for your Instagram followers. A cool quote-video might distract from the watermark, which is admittedly one of the larger ones on this list.</p> \n<p>Some of these apps might be worth investing in the paid version to create more unique images -- without the watermarks -- to post quotes on Instagram. But for now, try out these free options during the next <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ezYHn3gTVeI&amp;t=3s\">social media holiday</a> to see if your audience is ready to be inspired.</p>
