\">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 22 Mar 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ddd33609-1733-44d2-a811-a5435b201ffe.png","linkMd5":"d11dd84ba8e4048e1fe5834d68336707","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn27@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-30-537_a5901e98cb60ea43.webp","destWidth":754,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":7622,"destBytes":12106,"author":"pbump@hubspot.com (Pamela Bump)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ddd33609-1733-44d2-a811-a5435b201ffe.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn27@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-30-537_a5901e98cb60ea43.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/LinkedIn-Most-Trusted-Platform.jpg?width=650&name=LinkedIn-Most-Trusted-Platform.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn65@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-57-248_29e8c031d81f3917.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/24%20LinkedIn%20Stats%20That%20Marketers%20Need%20to%20Know%20in%202020%20(From%20the%20BIR-1-1.png?width=650&name=24%20LinkedIn%20Stats%20That%20Marketers%20Need%20to%20Know%20in%202020%20(From%20the%20BIR-1-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn77@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-59-896_25e798b67595e90a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/31%20LinkedIn%20Stats%20That%20Marketers%20Need%20to%20Know%20in%202021.jpeg?width=600&name=31%20LinkedIn%20Stats%20That%20Marketers%20Need%20to%20Know%20in%202021.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn78@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-50-02-180_1280f44ac8003035.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b612a0dc-34ea-4e79-908b-28874def7e5a.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn12@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-50-01-107_85ce3eb0b1d04252.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Flinkedin-stats&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn79@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-54-252_973ff88c5d4a8983.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370093},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"5 YouTube Description Templates That Have Helped Our Videos Go Viral","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/youtube-description-template","description":"<p>YouTube is the second largest search engine, with <a href=\"https://www.omnicoreagency.com/youtube-statistics/\">over 2 billion users</a> per month -- so it's an undeniably powerful channel for your marketing efforts.</p>  \n<p>However, if you don't use YouTube for your current marketing strategy, you're not alone. In fact, <a href=\"https://buffer.com/state-of-social-2019\">businesses choose Facebook as a channel over YouTube, even for video content</a>.</p> \n<p>In 2018, the HubSpot Academy team didn't take advantage of YouTube, either. But in the latter half of the year, the team feared the major losses in traffic they could face if they didn't hop on board -- so they implemented a strategy that enabled them to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/hubspot-academy-grew-youtube-subscribers\">grow YouTube subscribers by 25%</a> in just two months. Because YouTube is a search engine, part of that strategy relied on optimizing the videos to increase the chances of discoverability.</p> \n<p>One of the most important tactics for <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/youtube-seo\">optimizing your YouTube channel</a> is writing descriptive YouTube descriptions.</p> \n<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=0b51489d-5d5c-4054-b30c-86008871e5f1&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: 7 YouTube Video Description Templates [Free Prompts]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/0b51489d-5d5c-4054-b30c-86008871e5f1.png\" align=\"middle\"></a> \n<h3>YouTube Channel Description</h3> \n<p>A YouTube channel description is similar to the \"About\" page of a website. In fact, it even appears under the \"About\" tab of your channel's YouTube page.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/youtube-channel-description.gif?width=870&amp;name=youtube-channel-description.gif\" alt=\"youtube-channel-description\" width=\"870\" style=\"width: 870px;\">The YouTube channel description is meant to convey to potential viewers what your content is about: the topics you cover, the themes you tackle, and why. You'll not only need to convey <em>what&nbsp;</em>you discuss but also what you bring to the discussion and why they should listen to you. The goal here is to turn a one-time viewer into a long-term subscriber and consumer of your content. You'll be able to add this when <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-create-a-youtube-channel\">setting up your YouTube channel</a>.</p> \n<p>In addition to its primary goal of turning viewers into subscribers, this text can also be crawled by YouTube and could help your channel get found by people who are looking for channels like yours. With that in mind, be sure to use the terms that you think people would use to search for your content.</p> \n<h3>YouTube Video Description</h3> \n<p>The YouTube&nbsp;<em>video&nbsp;</em>description can be found underneath the viewport of the video itself.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/youtube-video-description.jpg?width=650&amp;name=youtube-video-description.jpg\" alt=\"youtube video description underneath video viewport\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px;\">While the YouTube channel description talks about the body of video content that you upload, each video will also need a unique description to increase the likelihood of your video getting found when someone is searching for a particular topic.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>In this video, the creator summarizes the question being asked and specifies the audience that the video is meant for. This text will help audiences (and YouTube) understand what the video is about. In addition, it's also prime real estate to include contact information and calls to action.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/youtube-video-description-example.jpg?width=650&amp;name=youtube-video-description-example.jpg\" alt=\"youtube-video-description-example\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px;\"></p> \n<p>Ultimately, if you're ready to begin <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/youtube-marketing\">using YouTube to attract and convert an audience</a>, it's critical you optimize your video descriptions for SEO. If you're unsure how to start crafting compelling YouTube descriptions, keep reading -- here, we'll explore various tactics you can employ, and provide templates to ensure you have everything you need to excel on YouTube.</p> \n<h2>How to Create Compelling YouTube Video Descriptions</h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/youtube-templates?hubs_post-cta=header\">Use YouTube Description Templates [Free Prompts]</a></h3> \n<p>HubSpot has compiled <strong>seven YouTube video description templates</strong> to help your business provide context to your viewers, rank better in search, organize your team, and link out to relevant webpages on your site.&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/youtube-templates?hubs_post-cta=image&amp;_ga=2.7182455.479289684.1614299805-235880503.1614299805\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Untitled%20design%20(88)-2.png?width=1140&amp;name=Untitled%20design%20(88)-2.png\" alt=\"HubSpot's 7 YouTube Video Description Templates\" width=\"1140\" style=\"width: 1140px;\"></a><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/youtube-templates?hubs_post-cta=imagebottom\">Download These Templates for Free</a></span></p> \n<h3>2. Explain what your video is about.</h3> \n<p>To explore the best tactics for writing YouTube descriptions, I spoke with <a href=\"https://twitter.com/EricPeters0/\">Eric Peters</a>, a Senior Growth Marketing Manager on HubSpot's Academy team. He told me, \"[YouTube descriptions] is one of the primary ways YouTube knows what your video is about. Include links, additional resources, links to other videos and playlists, etc. Make sure the description box is easy to read.\"</p> \n<p>As Peters notes, explaining your YouTube video and incorporating keywords into your description doesn't just help with SEO rankings -- it also helps with accessibility for people who are deaf and hard of hearing.&nbsp;For that reason, adding closed captions to your videos is an absolute must, too.</p> \n<p>For instance, take a look at one of <a href=\"https://youtube.com/hubspotacademy\">HubSpot Academy's YouTube</a> video descriptions:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/5%20YouTube%20Description%20Templates%20That%20Have%20Helped%20Our%20Videos%20Go%20Viral.png\" alt=\"Transcript for a YouTube Video Description\">\n</div> \n<p>As you can see, a YouTube description is incredibly different from a web page meta description. In a YouTube description, you have the space to go in-depth and explain what your entire video is about, and even link to external resources.</p> \n<p>Peters told me, \"You get 5,000 characters total, so make use of it. A lot of creators use asterisks or all-caps to differentiate titles from body copy because it's all plain text. Consider writing up a text version of the key points from the video, or even copying the transcription of the video into the description.\"</p> \n<h3>3. Include a CTA.</h3> \n<p>Your YouTube description is a fantastic opportunity to ask viewers to continue to engage with your channel or find additional resources that will help them learn more about a topic of interest.</p> \n<p>For instance, let's say you create a brief \"How to add filters to Instagram\" YouTube video, but you also have an in-depth, \"How to Use Instagram for Marketing\" blog post -- why not link to it in the description? More than likely, anyone who is watching your Instagram video on YouTube would be equally grateful for the opportunity to learn more via a blog post.</p> \n<p>Alternatively, perhaps you simply want to ask viewers to subscribe, turn on notifications, or share your content with their networks. These are all acceptable CTA's for your description.</p> \n<p>Additionally, it's critical you format your description to ensure you put the most important information first -- as Peters advises, \"The first 200 characters are above the 'more' fold on the description box, so if you want your CTA/link to be seen by the most people, keep it within the first 200 characters.\"</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/5%20YouTube%20Description%20Templates%20That%20Have%20Helped%20Our%20Videos%20Go%20Viral.jpeg\" alt=\"Collapsed YouTube Video Description With Show More Box Highlighted\">\n</div> \n<p>After the first 200 characters, your text will be cut-off, and viewers will need to click \"Show more\" to see the rest -- so it's vital you make your first 200 characters count.</p> \n<h3>4. Add your personality.</h3> \n<p>A YouTube description should be fun, and demonstrate your brand's personality or unique voice to an audience. Unlike more traditional forms of advertising, this is an opportunity for you to instill creativity and humor into your content.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/backlinko\">Brian Dean's YouTube channel</a> is a great example of this -- his YouTube descriptions often mirror the way he speaks. The descriptions are candid and casual, and he makes it feel like he's writing to a friend.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/5%20YouTube%20Description%20Templates%20That%20Have%20Helped%20Our%20Videos%20Go%20Viral-1.png\" alt=\"Brian Dean YouTube Video Description\">\n</div> \n<p>To learn more about using YouTube for marketing purposes, consider checking out HubSpot Academy's comprehensive <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/youtube-marketing\">YouTube Marketing course</a>.</p> \n<h2>YouTube Description Templates</h2> \n<p>Now that we've covered the basics, take a look at a few templates you can use to craft compelling YouTube descriptions today.</p> \n<h3>Templates for Your Channel Description</h3> \n<p>You might create a playful, easy-going channel 'About Me' description, like this one:</p> \n<div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui\"> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__head\">\n  YouTube Channel Description Example\n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__body\"> \n  <p>Hi, I'm [Name]. This is my channel about X, Y, and Z that you can use to grow your business.</p> \n  <p>If you're a marketer who wants to learn X to get [result, i.e. more traffic to your site], subscribe to my channel.</p> \n  <p>My channel publishes videos that focus on X, Y, and Z. If that sounds like it could be helpful for you, please join me!</p> \n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__foot\">\n  &nbsp;\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Alternatively, you can craft a YouTube description that describes what your company does from a third-person point of view, like this one:</p> \n<div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui\"> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__head\">\n  YouTube Channel Description Example\n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__body\"> \n  <p>Company A is the worldwide leader in X, Y, and Z. Since 2010, Company A has been on a mission to [insert company vision or purpose here].</p> \n  <p>To learn more about A, B, C, subscribe to our channel to stay informed.</p> \n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__foot\">\n  &nbsp;\n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>Templates for Your Video Descriptions</h3> \n<p>If you've conducted an internal interview, you might keep your description short-and-sweet to describe your conversation and why it matters to your audience, as well as a CTA:</p> \n<div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui\"> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__head\">\n  YouTube Video Description Example\n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__body\"> \n  <p>Hear how our CEO explains the difference between X and Y, and learn best practices for implementing your own strategy.</p> \n  <p>Learn more about X and Y in our course: www.XY.com</p> \n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__foot\">\n  &nbsp;\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Alternatively, if you want your description to help new viewers find your various channels, try crafting a description like this one:</p> \n<div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui\"> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__head\">\n  YouTube Video Description Example\n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__body\"> \n  <p>Hi there! New to [name of channel]? If so, here's what you need to know -- I like [interests related to channel] a LOT, so I use this channel to explore X, Y, and Z, to help you [desired result for viewer].</p> \n  <p>Where else you can find me:</p> \n  <p>INSTAGRAM: http://instagram.com/[accountname]</p> \n  <p>TWITTER: http://twitter.com/[accountname]</p> \n  <p>LIFESTYLE CHANNEL: http://www.youtube.com/[accountname]</p> \n  <p>Join our growing community for new videos every Tuesday and Friday!</p> \n  <p>BUSINESS INQUIRIES</p> \n  <p>Please contact [PR representative] at [email or phone number].</p> \n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__foot\">\n  &nbsp;\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Finally, if you want to focus on crafting a description that explains what your video is about and incorporates a keyword description, try this:</p> \n<div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui\"> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__head\">\n  YouTube Video Description Example\n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__body\"> \n  <p>Hey there! This lesson is part of a free online course. Take the full course here: www.company.com/course1</p> \n  <p>Some people are unsure what X is -- at its most basic, X is [brief definition of keyword]. In this video, you'll learn how to X, Y, and Z, to ensure you're able to grow your brand online.</p> \n  <p>Additionally, we'll explain how you can avoid doing A. Sometimes, A is all it takes to lose a customer.</p> \n </div> \n <div class=\"wt-blog__email-ui__foot\">\n  &nbsp;\n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Ultimately, YouTube description templates can help you reduce the amount of time it takes to upload and optimize your YouTube videos, getting them out to your audience quickly and with less effort. Just be sure to customize the text to enhance the reading experience because you want to be as helpful as possible for your audience.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in March 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<a class=\"cta_button\" alt=\"New call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/1856fa87-e54f-42a3-b543-94fb95c9a484.png\"></a>  \n<img Forsey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/0b51489d-5d5c-4054-b30c-86008871e5f1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn76@2020_5/2021/04/03/04-49-30-583_062408706165812c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/youtube-channel-description.gif?width=870&name=youtube-channel-description.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn12@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-50-00-225_b2abe4d22b50686e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/youtube-video-description.jpg?width=650&name=youtube-video-description.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn21@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-49-51-286_0530988e08d39be3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/youtube-video-description-example.jpg?width=650&name=youtube-video-description-example.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn19@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-51-549_39f20ca9e160b588.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Untitled%20design%20(88)-2.png?width=1140&name=Untitled%20design%20(88)-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn18@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-51-408_8f4f5ef31866c793.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/5%20YouTube%20Description%20Templates%20That%20Have%20Helped%20Our%20Videos%20Go%20Viral.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn52@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-50-00-531_1ef351ac27cde1bc.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/5%20YouTube%20Description%20Templates%20That%20Have%20Helped%20Our%20Videos%20Go%20Viral.jpeg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/5%20YouTube%20Description%20Templates%20That%20Have%20Helped%20Our%20Videos%20Go%20Viral-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn1@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-50-01-531_f5c1ade2e9d8dc71.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/1856fa87-e54f-42a3-b543-94fb95c9a484.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn76@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-50-00-829_11a911b9f868e969.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fyoutube-description-template&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn5@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-50-02-147_510d857045205aed.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370156},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"7 Effective Ways to Promote an Event on Facebook","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/promote-event-on-facebook","description":"<p>&nbsp;An <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/event-marketing\">event</a>&nbsp;is a fantastic opportunity to delight existing customers, while also reaching new audiences and increasing brand awareness.</p> \n<p>Consider, for instance, how I first came across <a href=\"https://www.southcoastopenairmarket.com/\">Southcoast Open Air Market</a>&nbsp;— a local, Massachusetts-based market featuring handmade goods, fresh produce and meats, and live music — by searching \"Events near me\" on Facebook.</p> \n<p>I never would've found the company if not for an event they posted recently:</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.50.02%20PM-min.png?width=423&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.50.02%20PM-min.png\" alt=\"SOAM event posting on Facebook \" width=\"423\" style=\"width: 423px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">And, thus, the ultimate power of online events: The ability to attract new customers to your business.</img></p> \n<p>Fortunately, an event doesn't have to be expensive. You can set up virtual <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ideas-for-facebook-live\">events and webinars with Facebook Live</a>&nbsp;for free, or create small events at your company's physical location to encourage new local visitors.</p> \n<p>Of course, one of the biggest challenges when hosting a Facebook event is spreading awareness of the event to both new and existing audiences.</p> \n<p>If you're going through the trouble of hosting an event, you want people to show up — and, better yet, you want people to continue spreading the word about your business even <em>after </em>the event is over.</p> \n<p>Here, we'll explore some creative opportunities you can use to promote an upcoming event on Facebook.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=9f7c45b7-c71b-4797-8d5d-e6b296fb6a83&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Free Resource: How to Reach &amp; Engage Your Audience on Facebook\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9f7c45b7-c71b-4797-8d5d-e6b296fb6a83.png\" /></a></p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">How to Promote an Event on Facebook</h2> \n<p>To demonstrate how to effectively promote an event on Facebook, let's walk through an example.</p> \n<p>Let's say I recently started a business — Caroline's cupcakes — and I want to host an event to drive new traffic to my page.</p> \n<p>But, once I've created the event … how do I <em>promote</em>&nbsp;it? Let's explore how to do that, next.</p> \n<p>It's important to note — in this section, we'll explore how to formally promote your event using Facebook advertising features, which means it costs money to run these promotions. If you're looking for cheaper or free alternatives, skip to the next section in this post, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/promote-event-on-facebook#best-ways-promote-facebook-event\">Best Ways to Promote an Event on Facebook</a>.</p> \n<p>Additionally, take a look at Facebook's instructions if <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/help/210413455658361\">you're new to creating a Facebook event</a>. You'll need a Facebook event to continue with these steps.</p> \n<p><strong>1. As soon as you've created your event, Facebook will serve you a pop-up that reads, \"Boost Your Online Event\". Click \"Boost Event\" to promote your event to new audiences.</strong></p> \n<p><img alt=\"Facebook's Boost Your Online Event pop-up\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/how%20to%20promote%20event%20on%20FB.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" /></p> \n<p><strong>Alternatively, if you clicked away from the pop-up or created the event a while ago, simply return to your company's page and click the \"Promote\" button displayed there:</strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Promote%20button%20on%20homepage%20to%20promote%20an%20event%20copy.jpg?width=1478&amp;name=Promote%20button%20on%20homepage%20to%20promote%20an%20event%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"The Promote button on your company's homepage, which you need to click to find the boost an event tool\" width=\"1478\" style=\"width: 1478px;\" /></p> \n<p><strong>And then click the box that reads, \"Boost an Event\".</strong></p> \n<p><strong><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Facebook%20options%20for%20promoting%20a%20business%20page%20copy.jpg?width=1256&amp;name=Facebook%20options%20for%20promoting%20a%20business%20page%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"Facebook's &quot;Boost an Event&quot; button\" width=\"1256\" style=\"width: 1256px;\" /></strong><strong>2. Next, fill in the Ad Creative you want to use when you promote the event, including an event description, image, and Ad Category. Here's where you want to use </strong><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/advertising\">advertising best practices</a></strong><strong>&nbsp;to ensure your copy and image attract new audiences when they come across your event.</strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Ad%20creative%20to%20boost%20an%20Event.png?width=470&amp;name=Ad%20creative%20to%20boost%20an%20Event.png\" alt=\"Ad Creative to boost an Event\" width=\"470\" style=\"width: 470px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"><strong>3. Once you've filled out the Ad Creative, you'll want to choose the Audience you want to see your event. Plug in certain key audience factors related to your target audience, or consider using </strong><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-lookalike-audiences\">Facebook's lookalike feature</a></strong><strong> to find similar people to those who already follow, Like, and engage with your content online. &nbsp;</strong></img></p> \n<p><strong><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-12%20at%209.14.38%20AM.png?width=494&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-12%20at%209.14.38%20AM.png\" alt=\"The Audience section of a form when you're filling out an ad on Facebook\" width=\"494\" style=\"width: 494px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></strong><strong>4. Finally, choose the duration for which you want to promote your event. We'd recommend promoting a few weeks before the event, so your audience has time to schedule it into their calendars and even invite friends or colleagues. Additionally, you'll want to choose your budget here, as well.</strong></p> \n<p><strong><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-12%20at%209.14.44%20AM.png?width=510&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-12%20at%209.14.44%20AM.png\" alt=\"The duration and budget section of an ad when you're filling out the ad form on Facebook\" width=\"510\" style=\"width: 510px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></strong><strong>5. Once you've finalized your ad, click \"Boost Event Now\" to ensure your event is shared with new, interested audiences.</strong></p> \n<p><strong><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Button,%20Boost%20Event%20Now,%20youll%20want%20to%20press%20when%20youre%20ready%20to%20boost%20your%20event.png?width=1444&amp;name=Button,%20Boost%20Event%20Now,%20youll%20want%20to%20press%20when%20youre%20ready%20to%20boost%20your%20event.png\" alt=\"The Boost Event Now button on the Ad form, which you'll want to press when you're ready to boost your event\" width=\"1444\" style=\"width: 1444px;\" /></strong>Of course, these steps can help you promote your event through advertising. But if you're on a strict budget, you might not have the resources to officially promote it.</p> \n<p>Fortunately, there are a few alternative best practices to promote your event — which I'd recommend doing even if you've officially boosted your event, as well.</p> \n<p>Let's explore those, now.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Best Ways to Promote an Event on Facebook</h2> \n<h3>1. Change your business' page settings so your Events are listed first when people find your business page.</h3> \n<p>When visitors find your business page, they'll see a few tabs at the top, including \"Home\", \"Group\", \"Photos\", etc.</p> \n<p>To increase traffic to your events page, consider re-organizing these tabs so an \"Event\" tab is listed first on your business page.</p> \n<p>To do this, click the \"More\" dropdown on your company page, and then select \"Edit Tabs\":</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.37.35%20PM-min.png?width=1784&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.37.35%20PM-min.png\" alt=\"The &quot;Edit Tabs&quot; button on your company Facebook page\" width=\"1784\" style=\"width: 1784px;\" /></p> \n<p>Next, drag the \"Events\" tab to the top, right under \"Home\":</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.37.56%20PM-min.png?width=465&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.37.56%20PM-min.png\" alt=\"The Settings page where you can rearrange the tabs on your Facebook business page\" width=\"465\" style=\"width: 465px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p>This is a small detail, but it could go a long way towards encouraging new page visitors to click and view upcoming events. &nbsp;</p> \n<h3>2. Share and pin your event to the top of your business page.</h3> \n<p>Even though you have a different page for your event invite, there's no reason you shouldn't be broadcasting the event on your business' official Facebook page, as well.</p> \n<p>To do this, share a post highlighting details about your event — including where people can sign up, when it is, and what content you'll cover. Then, right-click the three dots at the top right-hand corner of your Facebook post, and select \"<span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Pin to Top of Page</span>\":</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.47.03%20PM-min.png?width=814&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.47.03%20PM-min.png\" alt=\"The Pin to Top of Page button you'll need to press to keep an event at the top of your Facebook page\" width=\"814\" style=\"width: 814px;\" /></p> \n<p>This is another easy opportunity to promote your event. When both new and existing audiences come across your business page they'll see, front and center, a pinned post about your upcoming event.</p> \n<h3>3. Post a status highlighting the event from your business page.</h3> \n<p>A few days before the event, reach out to your page followers with a quick reminder status. Use images, emojis, and other fun, interactive elements to remind your audience about the upcoming event and increase excitement for it.</p> \n<p>If you can, publishing a short, promotional video could help raise awareness and excitement, as well. For instance, take a look at how <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/contentmarketingvirtualsummit\">Content Marketing Virtual Summit</a> published a short video from one of its webinar speakers, Ellie Hernaman, to remind followers of the upcoming event:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.52.38%20PM-min.png?width=465&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.52.38%20PM-min.png\" alt=\"Content Marketing Virtual Summit's Facebook video highlighting Ellie, a speaker for their Content Marketing Virtual Summit\" width=\"465\" style=\"width: 465px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<h3>4. Optimize your event page for wider reach.</h3> \n<p>If you're going through the trouble of promoting an event page, you'll want to make sure the event page itself is ready to attract and delight new viewers.</p> \n<p>A few small details can go a long way, here. For instance, consider using a unique, original image as your cover photo, as <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/thehoneypotcompany/events/?ref=page_internal\">The Honey Pot Company did with its Essence Wellness House Atlanta event</a>:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.57.47%20PM-min.png?width=950&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.57.47%20PM-min.png\" alt=\"A Overall Wellness cover photo showcasing the speakers at The Honey Pot Company's Atlanta event\" width=\"950\" style=\"width: 950px;\" /></p> \n<p>Additionally, use relevant tags related to your event — such as \"startup\" and \"technology\" — to ensure the event gets shared and viewed by the right channels.</p> \n<h3>5. Share your event to relevant Facebook groups.</h3> \n<p>If you've created a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/create-facebook-group\">Facebook group</a> for your business, this could be a good opportunity to broadcast your event to audiences who've already proven an interest in your brand.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Additionally, if you're a member of a Facebook group made up of people you believe would <em>truly</em> find an interest in your event, go ahead and share your event there as a member post.</p> \n<p>However, a word of caution: This can easily feel promotional and can backfire, particularly if members feel you're only sharing content related to your own business.</p> \n<p>Instead, you'll want to ensure it's authentic and helpful to the topic at-hand. For instance, if you're part of a Tech Startup Facebook group and your company is hosting a webinar, \"8 Impressive New Tech Startups to Watch\", then by all means — go ahead and post with a quick, \"Hey fellow members, feel free to join this webinar on Tuesday.\"</p> \n<p>Just be careful not to overdo it, particularly if it doesn't feel relevant to the other topics being discussed.</p> \n<h3>6. Copy the link and paste it into an email newsletter, or alternative channels to broadcast it to existing leads.</h3> \n<p>On your event page, you'll see a \"Share\" option (the arrow pointing to the right) — when you click on it, Facebook gives you an option to copy-and-paste a specific URL link, or share to a Page or group:&nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.44.23%20PM-min-1.png?width=1432&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.44.23%20PM-min-1.png\" alt=\"The Share button on your Cupcake Decorating Content where you can copy a link to share with others off Facebook\" width=\"1432\" style=\"width: 1432px;\">If you feel many of your prospects and customers engage with your brand outside of Facebook, it could be a good idea to copy-and-paste the URL into other channels and share with engaged followers on other social platforms.</img></p> \n<p>Additionally, you might consider opening your event for \"pre-access\" to an exclusive email subscriber list — like those who've purchased your product or service, or your Blog subscribers — on a \"first come, first serve\" basis. Here's an example of how that might look in practice:&nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.46.07%20PM-min.png?width=1034&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.46.07%20PM-min.png\" alt=\"An email to Caroline's cupcake customers, broadcasting an upcoming cupcake decorating content with a link to the Facebook event\" width=\"1034\" style=\"width: 1034px;\" /></p> \n<p>Ultimately, it's a good idea to paste the URL into other content channels to expand your reach. For instance, if you have a dedicated Instagram following, you might paste the URL into your Instagram bio.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>7. Ask other businesses or influencers to co-host or sponsor your event so they can share your event with their audiences.</h3> \n<p>One sure-fire opportunity to reach new audiences is by asking another business or influencer in the industry to co-host or sponsor your event.</p> \n<p>This can help you increase the amount of people who hear about your event, and it can also make the event itself more valuable by including unique, original thought leadership content.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>For instance, <a href=\"https://www.mandmribs.com/\">M&amp;M BBQ</a>, a Boston-based barbecue restaurant, partnered with <a href=\"https://www.dorchesterbrewing.com/\">Dorchester Brewing Company</a> to host events like Sunday brunch and combine its barbecue with Dorchester Brewing Company's popular beer.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Recently, Dorchester Brewing Company posted about the event with a link directly to M&amp;M BBQ:&nbsp;</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/dorchester%20brewing%20company%20.png?width=447&amp;name=dorchester%20brewing%20company%20.png\" alt=\"Dorchester Brewing Company's event post, highlight M&amp;M BBQ and inviting people to come eat barbecue and taste beers during Sunday brunch in Boston\" width=\"447\" style=\"width: 447px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" /></p> \n<p>This serves two purposes: First, any Facebook followers or customers of DBC might take an interest in M&amp;M BBQ as a result of the Facebook post (or an in-person experience of testing out the barbecue).</p> \n<p>And, second, Dorchester Brewing Company has increased value of its own event by providing its loyal customers with the option to eat delicious barbecue as they test out beers. A win, win.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Ultimately, you'll need to figure out which promotional methods work best for your brand, your event, and your audience. Fortunately, the sky's the limit when it comes to promoting an event on Facebook — both on, and off the social network.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b1ed53ce-abab-413f-b67a-846d53ac1657&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"generate leads with facebook\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1ed53ce-abab-413f-b67a-846d53ac1657.png\" /></a></p> \n<img /03/04-49-52-682_9b0ba9b67f25fd26.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Button,%20Boost%20Event%20Now,%20youll%20want%20to%20press%20when%20youre%20ready%20to%20boost%20your%20event.png?width=1444&name=Button,%20Boost%20Event%20Now,%20youll%20want%20to%20press%20when%20youre%20ready%20to%20boost%20your%20event.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn54@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-57-069_6d47a6cb96f54022.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.37.35%20PM-min.png?width=1784&name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.37.35%20PM-min.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn7@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-50-00-968_eef6155c4e88d0e2.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.37.56%20PM-min.png?width=465&name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.37.56%20PM-min.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn46@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-52-891_756717b47a3f5603.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.47.03%20PM-min.png?width=814&name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.47.03%20PM-min.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn24@2020_2/2021/04/03/04-50-00-249_a68040a070eb3a0a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.52.38%20PM-min.png?width=465&name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.52.38%20PM-min.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn16@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-50-00-529_e68a78f357aa0d27.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.57.47%20PM-min.png?width=950&name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.57.47%20PM-min.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn62@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-55-092_401ab65eb454bef2.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.44.23%20PM-min-1.png?width=1432&name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.44.23%20PM-min-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn81@2020_1/2021/04/03/04-49-58-486_4d39d7800b3962f3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.46.07%20PM-min.png?width=1034&name=Screen%20Shot%202021-03-11%20at%2012.46.07%20PM-min.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn74@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-58-473_4aee7c5b6a7be3d3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/dorchester%20brewing%20company%20.png?width=447&name=dorchester%20brewing%20company%20.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn23@2020_4/2021/04/03/04-49-55-839_3cf17b958c8ad441.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1ed53ce-abab-413f-b67a-846d53ac1657.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn40@2020_6/2021/04/03/04-49-55-798_43149526df2d3104.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fpromote-event-on-facebook&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn1@2020_3/2021/04/03/04-49-56-550_37332f098897193b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1617425370045},{"createdTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","updatedTime":"2021-04-03 12:49:30","title":"The Best Forum Software for Creating an Online Community in 2021","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-forum-software","description":"<p>Forums provide the opportunity to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/online-community-launch\">build an online community</a> that allows your audience to connect in a place where they know their interests are shared. This sense of connectedness is more important than ever in a time where more work, communication, and socialization is being done online.&nbsp;</p>  \n<p>Online communities are particularly beneficial for businesses because they allow customers to interact with each other in a smaller circle than they could via social media, which increases engagement and brand affinity.</p> \n<p>For instance, let's say one of your customers has a very unique problem with your product or service, and posts about it on your forum. That post is much easier to find than it would be on social media, where millions of users are talking about a million different things.</p> \n<p>Even better, maybe another forum user has faced that same problem and can answer their question before your service reps even see it.</p> \n<p>There is an incredible amount of value in reaching and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/how-to-create-a-forum-website\">building your community using a forum</a>. Here, we're going to explore the best forum software to get you started.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=b9960dd8-68b8-4caa-8a08-d3f7b7c3406e&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Get Started with HubSpot's Marketing Software for Free\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b9960dd8-68b8-4caa-8a08-d3f7b7c3406e.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<div></div> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://wordpress.com/\">WordPress</a> (With Plugin)</h3> \n<h4>Price: Free (plus the cost of hosting)</h4> \n<p>Using a multi-purpose platform like a CMS to power your online community allows you access to many different software options in the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/website/best-wordpress-forum-plugins\">form of plugins and applications</a>. For instance, you might use the <a href=\"https://bbpress.org/\">bbPress</a> plugin to create multisite forums, and maintain them from one dashboard within your WordPress site. This is a great option if you want to set up a regular website and forum together.</p> \n<p>There are many options to choose from using WordPress, all of which will provide you with the basic forum features you need, plus plenty of useful extras.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.47.09%20PM.png?width=1220&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.47.09%20PM.png\" alt=\"WordPress with bbPress forum plugin\" width=\"1220\" style=\"width: 1220px;\"><em><a href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/bbpress/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.joomla.org/\">Joomla!</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Starts at $99 per year (plus development and hosting costs)</h4> \n<p>Joomla! Is a CMS software like WordPress, but requires more attention to detail and management. This is a robust CMS that will power your forum plugins like <a href=\"https://www.kunena.org/\">Kunena</a> or <a href=\"https://stackideas.com/easydiscuss\">EasyDiscuss</a>, which are specifically created for Joomla!'s system. The price point comes from the open-source content management system, which will allow you to build powerful online applications alongside your forum software.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/joomla-kunena-forum-example.jpg?width=650&amp;name=joomla-kunena-forum-example.jpg\" alt=\"joomlapolis, a forum example using joomla! and kunena\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px;\"><em><a href=\"https://forum.joomla.org/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.discourse.org/\">Discourse</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Starts at $100 per month (plus cost of hosting)</h4> \n<p>Discourse is open-source forum software that you can in tandem with your existing website and CMS platform. Not only can community members use it on their mobile devices,&nbsp; but they'll also get dynamic notifications, badges, emoji, and more. Best of all, there's a built-in moderation system to help you protect your community from spam and abuse.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/discourse-forum-software.jpg?width=650&amp;name=discourse-forum-software.jpg\" alt=\"discourse forum software\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><em><a href=\"https://www.discourse.org/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://vanillaforums.com/en/\">Vanilla Forums</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Variable based on your needs</h4> \n<p>Vanilla has an abundance of features -- one of the most notable being the intuitive dashboard that lets you manage every aspect of your community forum. You can view stats, manage users, and use an advanced editor that recognizes HTML, BBCode, and Markdown using this software.</p> \n<p>Additionally, Vanilla gives you the ability to adjust permissions of forums or members if you're looking to control access. The software enables customers to submit, view and vote on ideas to drive innovation for your business, or use the Q&amp;A option to connect with and help each other get more out of your products or services. Best of all, Vanilla offers an on-boarding process with useful checklists, training materials, and help from one of their support reps.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.52.39%20PM.png?width=1594&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.52.39%20PM.png\" alt=\"Vanilla Forums example\" width=\"1594\" style=\"width: 1594px;\"><em><a href=\"https://vanillaforums.com/en/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://codoforum.com/\">Codoforum</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Free</h4> \n<p>Codoforum is forum software that has a fresh UI with modern design. It's simple, clean, and easy to use. Codoforum is built with PHP using the latest coding patterns and is fully compliant with new PSR standards. This software provides a responsive layout structure for mobile and desktop, SSO and integration, as well as mention notifications for users.</p> \n<p>Since it's free to use, Codoforum is a good option if you're still testing out forums or aren't sure whether they'll be useful for your own website and community.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.54.10%20PM.png?width=1800&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.54.10%20PM.png\" alt=\"Codoforum example\" width=\"1800\" style=\"width: 1800px;\"><em><a href=\"https://codoforum.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://www.phpbb.com/\">phpBB</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Free</h4> \n<p>PhpBB is a forum platform that has a typical and intuitive board set-up where users can post public or private messages. With phpBB, you can create as many internal messaging boards as you want without any additional costs.</p> \n<p>Additionally, you can use extensions to add new options to your forum community. This makes the software very customizable, and allows you to adapt the software to the growing needs of your audience.</p> \n<p>Among other things, phpBB lets you create password-protected forums for added security, sub-forums, the option to display active topics at the top of your forum, and the ability to add forum rules at the top of a forum to ensure your community abides by set guidelines.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/phpbb-forum-example.jpg?width=650&amp;name=phpbb-forum-example.jpg\" alt=\"phpbb forum example at opencart\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px;\"><em><a href=\"https://forum.opencart.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.vbulletin.com/\">VBulletin</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: vBulletin 5 Connect $249, $15/month</h4> \n<p>Over 100,000 websites are built on vBulletin -- including NASA, EA, and Sony Pictures -- so it's a popular option for hosting your forum. The software includes tons of great features, including built-in SEO, security, and responsive web design. With VBulletin you can have an unlimited hierarchy of forums as well as private forums.</p> \n<p>Best of all, VBulletin provides fun and unique features for your community members, including private messaging, a friends list, member birthdays (shown on the Forum homepage), and the ability to see who's online.</p> \n<p>VBulletin is not known for being the fastest forum, but its design is clean and it offers quality support for its users.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.57.35%20PM.png?width=2428&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.57.35%20PM.png\" alt=\"vBulletin forum example\" width=\"2428\" style=\"width: 2428px;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><em><a href=\"https://www.vbulletin.com/forum/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://invisioncommunity.com/\">Invision Community</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Varies for forum size/data needs, but starts at $45/month for 65 online visitors</h4> \n<p>IP Board was a very popular forum software that has since expanded to Invision Community, which includes a forum application in addition to its other offerings. According to the Invision Community website, the forums module powers thousands of message boards around the web, and Invision Community has many other community management apps to help you interact with your audience.</p> \n<p>The software allows your users to take control over their own online communities, which you can monitor at your discretion. For instance, Invision Community lets users create and manage their own communities, called \"Clubs\", which are fully integrated with your website -- these clubs get designated Club Leaders, who can add new forums, calendars, or galleries to the community.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.58.58%20PM.png?width=1742&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%201.58.58%20PM.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019-05-23 at 1.58.58 PM\" width=\"1742\" style=\"width: 1742px;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><em><a href=\"https://invisioncommunity.com/features/content/#forums\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://flarum.org/\">Flarum</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Free</h4> \n<p>Flaurm has a streamlined design that is extremely easy to navigate. Forums using this software are fully responsive, and features include smooth animations and available swipe features for mobile optimization. Flarum was built by the developers of esoTalk and FluxBB, two of the fastest forum platforms, and has great performance reviews.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%202.01.21%20PM.png?width=1442&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%202.01.21%20PM.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019-05-23 at 2.01.21 PM\" width=\"1442\" style=\"width: 1442px;\"><em><a href=\"https://flarum.org/features/\">Image Source</a>&nbsp;</em></p> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"https://mybb.com/\">MyBB</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Free</h4> \n<p>MyBB is a free and open-source forum software that powers thousands of communities. It features hundreds of plugins and themes for you to customize, and the users that exist on the forum will help you establish your own community. Users have also contributed to the translations available for the content on the software. Now, forums are available in over 30 languages to help you grow a more global community.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%202.05.41%20PM-1.png?width=2054&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%202.05.41%20PM-1.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019-05-23 at 2.05.41 PM-1\" width=\"2054\" style=\"width: 2054px;\"><em><a href=\"https://mybb.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>11. <a href=\"https://www.insided.com/\">inSided</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Variable based on your needs</h4> \n<p>inSided is a full-featured Community Platform aimed at Customer Success and Community professionals looking to increase engagement, advocacy, and effectively gather product feedback.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>They have a killer combination of a customer community platform, a knowledge base, and in-app support. What sets them apart from other platforms are integrations with software like Zendesk, Salesforce, Mixpanel, and Gainsight so that you can connect your community to your entire tech-stack and create a 360 degree view of your customer.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/mixpanel_community.png?width=1640&amp;name=mixpanel_community.png\" alt=\"mixpanel_community\" width=\"1640\" style=\"width: 1640px;\"><a href=\"https://www.insided.com/\"><em>Image Source</em></a></p> \n<h2>Ways to Build Your Community Using Forum Software</h2> \n<p>People notice when brands listen to and converse with their customers, and they especially notice when brands foster their own communities. How? Through the power of <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/30490/the-qualities-of-a-powerful-word-of-mouth-marketing-strategy.aspx?_ga=2.81138783.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">word-of-mouth marketing</a>. Customers who view themselves as valued members of your community are much more likely to talk about your brand to their friends.</p> \n<p>Here's how you can build a strong community using your forum software.</p> \n<h3>1. Spread the word.</h3> \n<p>Nobody will join your online community if they don't know it exists. Spread the word about your new forum by including CTAs to join your forum in email newsletters or social posts. Ask your brand ambassadors or loyal fans to start posting about the forum, and post content on the forum so when other users join, you already have an established presence on the channel.</p> \n<h3>2. Listen to and check on your community regularly.</h3> \n<p>Reviewing your forum and responding to what your audience has to say is a crucial part of community building. Your customers are far less likely to continue to interact and engage on your forum if they feel as though they are being ignored. Responding to their feedback shows your users that you value their opinions and care about their experiences with your product.</p> \n<p>Additionally, it's your job to make sure everything is running smoothly on your forum. Checking on your community regularly will help you dissolve any service escalations, and give people the support they are seeking.</p> \n<h3>3. Foster a helpful discourse.</h3> \n<p>A forum should be a safe place for your customers, prospects, employees, fans, and audience to interact, ask, and answer questions. By establishing a helpful ethos early on, or creating community guidelines that prioritize patience and kindness within responses, your community will grow without the need to constantly monitor it 24/7.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in June 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=39441929-8c6f-4361-849c-69692c8ed5c4&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-Action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/39441929-8c6f-4361-849c-69692c8ed5c4.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img
